data-message-id="fd023e72-2bc0-4189-9d9f-b54a52098d95" dir="auto" class="min-h-8 text-message relative flex w-full flex-col items-end gap-2 text-start break-words whitespace-normal [.text-message+&amp;]:mt-5" data-message-model-slug="gpt-4o"><div class="flex w-full flex-col gap-1 empty:hidden first:pt-[3px]"><div class="markdown prose dark:prose-invert w-full break-words light"><p data-start="0" data-end="382">¡Genial decisión! Hacer un proyecto personal es una excelente forma de destacar y consolidar lo aprendido. Como acabas de terminar el primer curso, probablemente ya tengas conocimientos básicos de programación (Python), álgebra lineal, estadística, algo de bases de datos y visualización de datos. Aquí van varias ideas de proyectos relacionados con Canarias, adaptadas a ese nivel:</p>
<hr data-start="384" data-end="387">
<h3 data-start="389" data-end="446">🌋 1. <strong data-start="399" data-end="446">Análisis de Actividad Volcánica en Canarias</strong></h3>
<p data-start="447" data-end="566"><strong data-start="447" data-end="456">Tipo:</strong> Análisis exploratorio + visualización<br data-start="494" data-end="497">
<strong data-start="497" data-end="517">Fuente de datos:</strong> Instituto Geográfico Nacional (IGN)<br data-start="553" data-end="556">
<strong data-start="556" data-end="566">Ideas:</strong></p>
<ul data-start="567" data-end="760">
<li data-start="567" data-end="641">
<p data-start="569" data-end="641">Estudia los sismos y erupciones volcánicas (por ejemplo, La Palma 2021).</p>
</li>
<li data-start="642" data-end="704">
<p data-start="644" data-end="704">Visualiza en un mapa los epicentros y la evolución temporal.</p>
</li>
<li data-start="705" data-end="760">
<p data-start="707" data-end="760">Analiza frecuencia, magnitud y profundidad de sismos.</p>
</li>
</ul>
<hr data-start="762" data-end="765">
<h3 data-start="767" data-end="813">🏖️ 2. <strong data-start="778" data-end="813">Estudio del Turismo en Canarias</strong></h3>
<p data-start="814" data-end="940"><strong data-start="814" data-end="823">Tipo:</strong> Análisis descriptivo + dashboards<br data-start="857" data-end="860">
<strong data-start="860" data-end="880">Fuente de datos:</strong> Instituto Canario de Estadística (ISTAC), AENA<br data-start="927" data-end="930">
<strong data-start="930" data-end="940">Ideas:</strong></p>
<ul data-start="941" data-end="1120">
<li data-start="941" data-end="985">
<p data-start="943" data-end="985">Evolución del número de turistas por isla.</p>
</li>
<li data-start="986" data-end="1027">
<p data-start="988" data-end="1027">Análisis estacional y por nacionalidad.</p>
</li>
<li data-start="1028" data-end="1065">
<p data-start="1030" data-end="1065">Impacto del COVID-19 en el turismo.</p>
</li>
<li data-start="1066" data-end="1120">
<p data-start="1068" data-end="1120">Visualizaciones interactivas con Plotly o Streamlit.</p>
</li>
</ul>
<hr data-start="1122" data-end="1125">
<h3 data-start="1127" data-end="1194">🧑‍🌾 3. <strong data-start="1140" data-end="1194">Análisis del Cambio en Uso del Suelo o Agricultura</strong></h3>
<p data-start="1195" data-end="1325"><strong data-start="1195" data-end="1204">Tipo:</strong> Series temporales + visualización geoespacial<br data-start="1250" data-end="1253">
<strong data-start="1253" data-end="1273">Fuente de datos:</strong> Copernicus (Sentinel-2), ISTAC, SIGPAC<br data-start="1312" data-end="1315">
<strong data-start="1315" data-end="1325">Ideas:</strong></p>
<ul data-start="1326" data-end="1498">
<li data-start="1326" data-end="1387">
<p data-start="1328" data-end="1387">Usa imágenes satelitales para detectar cambios en cultivos.</p>
</li>
<li data-start="1388" data-end="1438">
<p data-start="1390" data-end="1438">Estudia el abandono agrícola o expansión urbana.</p>
</li>
<li data-start="1439" data-end="1498">
<p data-start="1441" data-end="1498">Aplica clustering para clasificar tipos de uso del suelo.</p>
</li>
</ul>
<hr data-start="1500" data-end="1503">
<h3 data-start="1505" data-end="1561">🌬️ 4. <strong data-start="1516" data-end="1561">Análisis de Energía Renovable en Canarias</strong></h3>
<p data-start="1562" data-end="1680"><strong data-start="1562" data-end="1571">Tipo:</strong> Estadística + visualización<br data-start="1599" data-end="1602">
<strong data-start="1602" data-end="1622">Fuente de datos:</strong> Red Eléctrica Española, Gobierno de Canarias<br data-start="1667" data-end="1670">
<strong data-start="1670" data-end="1680">Ideas:</strong></p>
<ul data-start="1681" data-end="1841">
<li data-start="1681" data-end="1734">
<p data-start="1683" data-end="1734">Evolución de la generación eólica y solar por isla.</p>
</li>
<li data-start="1735" data-end="1797">
<p data-start="1737" data-end="1797">Comparativa entre consumo energético y generación renovable.</p>
</li>
<li data-start="1798" data-end="1841">
<p data-start="1800" data-end="1841">Predicción sencilla con regresión lineal.</p>
</li>
</ul>
<hr data-start="1843" data-end="1846">
<h3 data-start="1848" data-end="1894">🌊 5. <strong data-start="1858" data-end="1894">Datos Oceánicos y Meteorológicos</strong></h3>
<p data-start="1895" data-end="1994"><strong data-start="1895" data-end="1904">Tipo:</strong> Análisis + visualización interactiva<br data-start="1941" data-end="1944">
<strong data-start="1944" data-end="1955">Fuente:</strong> AEMET, Puertos del Estado<br data-start="1981" data-end="1984">
<strong data-start="1984" data-end="1994">Ideas:</strong></p>
<ul data-start="1995" data-end="2155">
<li data-start="1995" data-end="2055">
<p data-start="1997" data-end="2055">Visualiza temperaturas del mar, oleaje o viento por zonas.</p>
</li>
<li data-start="2056" data-end="2094">
<p data-start="2058" data-end="2094">Busca correlaciones entre variables.</p>
</li>
<li data-start="2095" data-end="2155">
<p data-start="2097" data-end="2155">Crea un panel visual para surfistas, pescadores o turismo.</p>
</li>
</ul>
<hr data-start="2157" data-end="2160">
<h3 data-start="2162" data-end="2218">🚏 6. <strong data-start="2172" data-end="2218">Transporte Público y Movilidad en Canarias</strong></h3>
<p data-start="2219" data-end="2363"><strong data-start="2219" data-end="2228">Tipo:</strong> Visualización de redes + estadística<br data-start="2265" data-end="2268">
<strong data-start="2268" data-end="2279">Fuente:</strong> Datos abiertos de Titsa (Tenerife), Guaguas Municipales (Gran Canaria)<br data-start="2350" data-end="2353">
<strong data-start="2353" data-end="2363">Ideas:</strong></p>
<ul data-start="2364" data-end="2478">

dir="auto" data-testid="conversation-turn-4" data-scroll-anchor="false" style=""><h6 class="sr-only">ChatGPT Plus</h6><div class="text-base my-auto mx-auto py-5 [--thread-content-margin:--spacing(4)] @[37rem]:[--thread-content-margin:--spacing(6)] @[72rem]:[--thread-content-margin:--spacing(16)] px-(--thread-content-margin)"><div class="[--thread-content-max-width:32rem] @[34rem]:[--thread-content-max-width:40rem] @[64rem]:[--thread-content-max-width:48rem] mx-auto flex max-w-(--thread-content-max-width) flex-1 text-base gap-4 md:gap-5 lg:gap-6 group/turn-messages focus-visible:outline-hidden" tabindex="-1"><div class="group/conversation-turn relative flex w-full min-w-0 flex-col agent-turn"><div class="relative flex-col gap-1 md:gap-3"><div class="flex max-w-full flex-col grow"><div data-message-author-role="assistant" data-message-id="c6357ab4-1261-41b4-943c-ad1a7f128df0" dir="auto" class="min-h-8 text-message relative flex w-full flex-col items-end gap-2 text-start break-words whitespace-normal [.text-message+&amp;]:mt-5" data-message-model-slug="gpt-4o"><div class="flex w-full flex-col gap-1 empty:hidden first:pt-[3px]"><div class="markdown prose dark:prose-invert w-full break-words light"><p data-start="0" data-end="182">¡Perfecto! Un <strong data-start="14" data-end="45">panel visual para surfistas</strong> es una idea práctica, llamativa y con mucho potencial, sobre todo en Canarias, donde el surf es muy popular durante todo el año 🌊🏄‍♀️.</p>
<hr data-start="184" data-end="187">
<h2 data-start="189" data-end="220">🧠 <strong data-start="195" data-end="220">Objetivo del Proyecto</strong></h2>
<p data-start="221" data-end="385">Crear un <strong data-start="230" data-end="255">dashboard interactivo</strong> que muestre información útil para surfistas en las costas de Canarias. Este puede incluir datos en tiempo real o históricos como:</p>
<ul data-start="387" data-end="540">
<li data-start="387" data-end="422">
<p data-start="389" data-end="422">Altura y periodo de las olas 🌊</p>
</li>
<li data-start="423" data-end="462">
<p data-start="425" data-end="462">Dirección y velocidad del viento 💨</p>
</li>
<li data-start="463" data-end="490">
<p data-start="465" data-end="490">Temperatura del mar 🌡️</p>
</li>
<li data-start="491" data-end="504">
<p data-start="493" data-end="504">Mareas 🌙</p>
</li>
<li data-start="505" data-end="540">
<p data-start="507" data-end="540">Localización de spots de surf 🗺️</p>
</li>
</ul>
<hr data-start="542" data-end="545">
<h2 data-start="547" data-end="578">🛠️ Tecnologías Recomendadas</h2>
<ul data-start="579" data-end="955">
<li data-start="579" data-end="636">
<p data-start="581" data-end="636"><strong data-start="581" data-end="591">Python</strong>: para obtener, limpiar y procesar los datos.</p>
</li>
<li data-start="637" data-end="681">
<p data-start="639" data-end="681"><strong data-start="639" data-end="657">Pandas / NumPy</strong>: manipulación de datos.</p>
</li>
<li data-start="682" data-end="747">
<p data-start="684" data-end="747"><strong data-start="684" data-end="713">Plotly / Dash o Streamlit</strong>: para crear el panel interactivo.</p>
</li>
<li data-start="748" data-end="800">
<p data-start="750" data-end="800"><strong data-start="750" data-end="769">Folium o Mapbox</strong>: para mapas con spots de surf.</p>
</li>
<li data-start="801" data-end="955">
<p data-start="803" data-end="955"><strong data-start="803" data-end="811">APIs</strong>: como la de <a data-start="824" data-end="861" class="" rel="noopener" target="_new" href="https://open-meteo.com/">Open-Meteo</a> o <a data-start="864" data-end="900" class="" rel="noopener" target="_new" href="https://stormglass.io/">Stormglass</a>, que ofrecen datos meteorológicos y marinos gratuitos.</p>
</li>
</ul>
<hr data-start="957" data-end="960">
<h2 data-start="962" data-end="999">📊 ¿Qué se podría ver en el panel?</h2>
<div class="_tableContainer_80l1q_1"><div tabindex="-1" class="_tableWrapper_80l1q_14 group flex w-fit flex-col-reverse"><table data-start="1001" data-end="1589" class="w-fit min-w-(--thread-content-width)"><thead data-start="1001" data-end="1053"><tr data-start="1001" data-end="1053"><th data-start="1001" data-end="1028" data-col-size="sm">Componente</th><th data-start="1028" data-end="1053" data-col-size="md">Ejemplo o idea visual</th></tr></thead><tbody data-start="1108" data-end="1589"><tr data-start="1108" data-end="1212"><td data-start="1108" data-end="1135" data-col-size="sm"><strong data-start="1110" data-end="1127">Mapa de spots</strong></td><td data-col-size="md" data-start="1135" data-end="1212">Mapa interactivo con marcadores para El Confital, El Médano, El Quemao...</td></tr><tr data-start="1213" data-end="1299"><td data-start="1213" data-end="1240" data-col-size="sm"><strong data-start="1215" data-end="1238">Olas en tiempo <hr data-start="1960" data-end="1963">
<h2 data-start="1965" data-end="1987">📌 Siguientes pasos</h2>
<ol data-start="1989" data-end="2429">
<li data-start="1989" data-end="2079">
<p data-start="1992" data-end="2079"><strong data-start="1992" data-end="2020">Elegir 3-5 spots de surf</strong> que te interesen (p. ej. Famara, El Médano, El Confital…).</p>
</li>
<li data-start="2080" data-end="2191">
<p data-start="2083" data-end="2191"><strong data-start="2083" data-end="2101">Consultar APIs</strong> disponibles y gratuitas (puedo ayudarte a conectarte a una como Open-Meteo o Stormglass).</p>
</li>
<li data-start="2192" data-end="2286">
<p data-start="2195" data-end="2286"><strong data-start="2195" data-end="2215">Diseñar el panel</strong>: primero en papel o Figma (opcional), luego lo montamos con Streamlit.</p>
</li>
<li data-start="2287" data-end="2338">
<p data-start="2290" data-end="2338"><strong data-start="2290" data-end="2337">Mostrar datos históricos y/o en tiempo real</strong>.</p>
</li>
<li data-start="2339" data-end="2429">
<p data-start="2342" data-end="2429"><strong data-start="2342" data-end="2355">Opcional:</strong> Añadir alertas de condiciones ideales o ranking de mejores spots del día.</p>
</li>
</ol>
<hr data-start="2431" data-end="2434">
<p data-start="2436" data-end="2640" data-is-last-node="" data-is-only-node="">¿Quieres que te ayude a arrancar con una plantilla base en Streamlit + conexión a una API para datos del mar en Canarias? También dime si prefieres hacer esto enfocado a alguna isla concreta o para todas.</p></div></div></div></div><div class="flex min-h-[46px] justify-start"><div class="touch:-me-2 touch:-ms-3.5 -ms-2.5 -me-1 flex flex-wrap items-center gap-y-4 p-1 select-none touch:w-[calc(100%+--spacing(3.5))] -mt-1 w-[calc(100%+--spacing(2.5))] duration-[1.5s] focus-within:transition-none hover:transition-none pointer-events-none [mask-image:linear-gradient(to_right,black_33%,transparent_66%)] [mask-size:300%_100%] [mask-position:100%_0%] motion-safe:transition-[mask-position] group-hover/turn-messages:pointer-events-auto group-hover/turn-messages:[mask-position:0_0] group-focus-within/turn-messages:pointer-events-auto group-focus-within/turn-messages:[mask-position:0_0] has-data-[state=open]:pointer-events-auto has-data-[state=open]:[mask-position:0_0]" style="mask-position: 0% 0%;"><button class="text-token-text-secondary hover:bg-token-bg-secondary rounded-lg" aria-label="Copiar" aria-selected="false" data-testid="copy-turn-action-button" data-state="closed"><span class="touch:w-10 flex h-8 w-8 items-center justify-center"><svg width="20" height="20" class="markdown prose dark:prose-invert w-full break-words light"><p data-start="0" data-end="67">¡Perfecto! Elegiste <strong data-start="20" data-end="66">cuatro spots muy populares de Gran Canaria</strong>:</p>
<ul data-start="69" data-end="256">
<li data-start="69" data-end="114">
<p data-start="71" data-end="114">🏄 <strong data-start="74" data-end="86">La Cícer</strong> (Las Canteras – Las Palmas)</p>
</li>
<li data-start="115" data-end="164">
<p data-start="117" data-end="164">🏄 <strong data-start="120" data-end="135">El Confital</strong> (más técnico, olas potentes)</p>
</li>
<li data-start="165" data-end="204">
<p data-start="167" data-end="204">🏄 <strong data-start="170" data-end="181">La Laja</strong> (al sur de Las Palmas)</p>
</li>
<li data-start="205" data-end="256">
<p data-start="207" data-end="256">🏄 <strong data-start="210" data-end="224">San Andrés</strong> (norte, más expuesto al oleaje)</p>
</li>
</ul>
<p data-start="258" data-end="359">Vamos a preparar un <strong data-start="278" data-end="321">panel visual interactivo para surfistas</strong> centrado en <strong data-start="334" data-end="358">estos cuatro lugares</strong>.</p>
<hr data-start="361" data-end="364">
<h2 data-start="366" data-end="392">✅ Plan para el Proyecto</h2>
<h3 data-start="394" data-end="413">🎯 <strong data-start="401" data-end="413">Objetivo</strong></h3>
<p data-start="414" data-end="557">Visualizar y comparar condiciones del mar y el viento para los cuatro spots en tiempo real (y, si quieres, también históricas o de predicción).</p>
<hr data-start="559" data-end="562">
<h3 data-start="564" data-end="599">🔍 <strong data-start="571" data-end="599">Datos que puedes mostrar</strong></h3>
<ol data-start="600" data-end="794">
<li data-start="600" data-end="625">
<p data-start="603" data-end="625"><strong data-start="603" data-end="625">Altura de las olas</strong></p>
</li>
<li data-start="626" data-end="675">
<p data-start="629" data-end="675"><strong data-start="629" data-end="652">Periodo de las olas</strong> (tiempo entre crestas)</p>
</li>
<li data-start="676" data-end="703">
<p data-start="679" data-end="703"><strong data-start="679" data-end="703">Dirección del oleaje</strong></p>
</li>
<li data-start="704" data-end="741">
<p data-start="707" data-end="741"><strong data-start="707" data-end="717">Viento</strong> (velocidad y dirección)</p>
</li>
<li data-start="742" data-end="768">
<p data-start="745" data-end="768"><strong data-start="745" data-end="768">Temperatura del mar</strong></p>
</li>
<li data-start="769" data-end="794">
<p data-start="772" data-end="794"><strong data-start="772" data-end="794">Estado de la marea</strong></p>
</li>
</ol>
<hr data-start="796" data-end="799">
<h3 data-start="801" data-end="836">📦 <strong data-start="808" data-end="836">APIs gratuitas sugeridas</strong></h3>
<ul data-start="837" data-end="1081">
<li data-start="837" data-end="955">
<p data-start="839" data-end="955"><strong data-start="839" data-end="882"><a data-start="841" data-end="880" class="" rel="noopener" target="_new" href="https://stormglass.io/">Stormglass.io</a></strong> – hasta 10 llamadas por día gratis (olas, viento, temperatura del mar…).</p>
</li>
<li data-start="956" data-end="1081">
<p data-start="958" data-end="1081"><strong data-start="958" data-end="1003"><a data-start="960" data-end="1001" class="" rel="noopener" target="_new" href="https://open-meteo.com/">Open-Meteo.com</a></strong> – sin autenticación, muy fácil de usar (ofrece oleaje, viento, mareas, etc.).</p>
</li>
</ul>
<p data-start="1083" data-end="1188">Puedo ayudarte a conectarte a una de ellas para recoger datos de cada spot (por coordenadas geográficas).</p>

<hr data-start="1971" data-end="1974">
<h2 data-start="1976" data-end="2007">🚀 ¿Qué quieres hacer ahora?</h2>
<ol data-start="2009" data-end="2320">
<li data-start="2009" data-end="2139">
<p data-start="2012" data-end="2139">¿Quieres que te prepare un <strong data-start="2039" data-end="2067">código base en Streamlit</strong> con conexión a <strong data-start="2083" data-end="2097">Open-Meteo</strong>, mostrando condiciones para esos 4 spots?</p>
</li>
<li data-start="2140" data-end="2235">
<p data-start="2143" data-end="2235">¿Prefieres usar otra librería (como Dash) o simplemente un análisis con gráficos en Jupyter?</p>
</li>
<li data-start="2236" data-end="2320">
<p data-start="2239" data-end="2320">¿Quieres mostrar datos <strong data-start="2262" data-end="2280">en tiempo real</strong>, o también incluir análisis históricos?</p>
</li>
</ol>
<p data-start="2322" data-end="2378" data-is-last-node="" data-is-only-node="">Dime qué prefieres y te monto el esqueleto del proyecto.</p></div></div></div></div><div class="flex min-h-[46px] <hr data-start="618" data-end="621">
<h2 data-start="623" data-end="643">🔧 ¿Qué usaremos?</h2>
<h3 data-start="645" data-end="670">🌀 Open-Meteo ofrece:</h3>
<ul data-start="671" data-end="973">
<li data-start="671" data-end="734">
<p data-start="673" data-end="734">🌊 <strong data-start="676" data-end="687">Oleaje:</strong> <code data-start="688" data-end="701">wave_height</code>, <code data-start="703" data-end="719">wave_direction</code>, <code data-start="721" data-end="734">wave_period</code></p>
</li>
<li data-start="735" data-end="782">
<p data-start="737" data-end="782">💨 <strong data-start="740" data-end="751">Viento:</strong> <code data-start="752" data-end="764">wind_speed</code>, <code data-start="766" data-end="782">wind_direction</code></p>
</li>
<li data-start="783" data-end="839">
<p data-start="785" data-end="839">🌡️ <strong data-start="789" data-end="813">Temperatura del mar:</strong> <code data-start="814" data-end="839">sea_surface_temperature</code></p>
</li>
<li data-start="840" data-end="879">
<p data-start="842" data-end="879">🌙 <strong data-start="845" data-end="856">Mareas:</strong> desde su API de mareas</p>
</li>
<li data-start="880" data-end="973">
<p data-start="882" data-end="973">🕓 <strong data-start="885" data-end="911">Histórico y predicción</strong>: puedes pedir datos por fecha y hora para el spot que quieras</p>
</li>
</ul>
<hr data-start="975" data-end="978">
<h2 data-start="980" data-end="1012">✨ Paso 1: ¿Qué hará el panel?</h2>
<ul data-start="1014" data-end="1310">
<li data-start="1014" data-end="1071">
<p data-start="1016" data-end="1071">Mostrar los <strong data-start="1028" data-end="1044">cuatro spots</strong> con selección en Streamlit</p>
</li>
<li data-start="1072" data-end="1117">
<p data-start="1074" data-end="1117">Cargar datos actuales y de los últimos días</p>
</li>
<li data-start="1118" data-end="1212">
<p data-start="1120" data-end="1140">Mostrar gráficos de:</p>
<ul data-start="1143" data-end="1212">
<li data-start="1143" data-end="1163">
<p data-start="1145" data-end="1163">Altura de las olas</p>
</li>
<li data-start="1166" data-end="1187">
<p data-start="1168" data-end="1187">Dirección y periodo</p>
</li>
<li data-start="1190" data-end="1212">
<p data-start="1192" data-end="1212">Viento y temperatura</p>
</li>
</ul>
</li>
<li data-start="1213" data-end="1310">
<p data-start="1215" data-end="1310">(Opcional) Marcar en verde si el spot tiene “condiciones buenas” para surf según ciertas reglas</p>
</li>
</ul>
<hr data-start="1312" data-end="1315">
<h2 data-start="1317" data-end="1437">✅ Siguiente paso: ¿quieres que te genere ahora mismo el archivo <code data-start="1384" data-end="1392">app.py</code> con una primera versión funcional del panel?</h2>
<p data-start="1439" data-end="1448">Incluiré:</p>
<ul data-start="1449" data-end="1591">
<li data-start="1449" data-end="1472">
<p data-start="1451" data-end="1472">Menú para elegir spot</p>
</li>
<li data-start="1473" data-end="1536">
<p data-start="1475" data-end="1536">Llamada a Open-Meteo para predicción actual y días anteriores</p>
</li>
<li data-start="1537" data-end="1558">
<p data-start="1539" data-end="1558">Gráficos con Plotly</p>
</li>
<li data-start="1559" data-end="1591">
<p data-start="1561" data-end="1591">Mapa con los 4 puntos marcados</p>
</li>
</ul>

<h2 data-start="480" data-end="509">🧭 Qué incluye ahora mismo</h2>
<ul data-start="511" data-end="808">

</li>
<li data-start="580" data-end="659">
<p data-start="582" data-end="659">Datos de los últimos <strong data-start="603" data-end="630">3 días más hoy y mañana</strong> (para análisis y predicción)</p>
</li>
<li data-start="660" data-end="746">
<p data-start="662" data-end="684">Gráficos interactivos:</p>
<ul data-start="687" data-end="746">

</li>

</li>

</li>
</ul>
</li>

</li>

<hr data-start="810" data-end="813">
<h2 data-start="815" data-end="850">🛠️ ¿Qué podríamos añadir luego?</h2>
<ul data-start="852" data-end="1146">
<li data-start="852" data-end="922">
<p data-start="854" data-end="922">Mapa interactivo con los spots marcados (usando <code data-start="902" data-end="910">folium</code> o <code data-start="913" data-end="921">pydeck</code>)</p>
</li>
<li data-start="923" data-end="962">
<p data-start="925" data-end="962">Indicador de mareas (usando otra API)</p>
</li>
<li data-start="963" data-end="1013">
<p data-start="965" data-end="1013">Reglas personalizadas para “condiciones ideales”</p>
</li>
<li data-start="1014" data-end="1062">
<p data-start="1016" data-end="1062">Exportar datos a CSV o guardar histórico local</p>
</li>
<li data-start="1063" data-end="1146">
<p data-start="1065" data-end="1146">Hosting gratuito (por ejemplo, con <a data-start="1100" data-end="1145" rel="noopener" target="_new" class="cursor-pointer">Streamlit Cloud</a>)</p>
</li>
</ul>

<p data-start="323" data-end="465">Si <strong data-start="326" data-end="369">no te devuelve algo como <code data-start="353" data-end="367">Python 3.x.x</code></strong>, tendrás que instalar <a data-start="392" data-end="464" class="" rel="noopener" target="_new" href="https://www.python.org/downloads/windows/">Python desde la web oficial</a>.</p>
<hr data-start="467" data-end="470">

<p data-start="655" data-end="817">Esto instalará Streamlit globalmente. También puedes crear un entorno virtual si prefieres no ensuciar el sistema, pero de momento puedes probar así directamente.</p>

<h3 data-start="1284" data-end="1331">b) Reinicia la terminal después de instalar</h3>
<hr data-start="1333" data-end="1336">
<p data-start="1338" data-end="1544" data-is-last-node="" data-is-only-node="">¿Te gustaría que prepare un archivo <code data-start="1374" data-end="1380">.bat</code> para que puedas lanzarlo haciendo doble clic si usas Windows? <p data-start="283" data-end="354">Si te devuelve algo como <code data-start="308" data-end="322">Python 3.x.x</code>, perfecto.<br data-start="333" data-end="336">

<blockquote data-start="552" data-end="584">
<p data-start="554" data-end="584">Si no tienes <code data-start="567" data-end="571">py</code>, prueba con:</p>
</blockquote>

</span></span></code></div></div></pre>
<p data-start="630" data-end="743">Este comando fuerza la instalación usando el módulo <code data-start="682" data-end="687">pip</code> del propio Python, que suele evitar errores de entorno.</p>
<hr data-start="745" data-end="748">
<h2 data-start="750" data-end="788">✅ 3. Ejecuta Streamlit desde Python</h2>
<p data-start="790" data-end="847">Una vez instalada, en lugar de usar <code data-start="826" data-end="837">streamlit</code>, escribe:</p>

<p data-start="889" data-end="908">o si usas <code data-start="899" data-end="907">python</code>:</p>

</span></span></code></div></div></pre>
<p data-start="954" data-end="1017">Esto te abrirá la app directamente en el navegador (localhost).</p>
<hr data-start="1019" data-end="1022">
<h2 data-start="1024" data-end="1053">🔁 Si nada de eso funciona</h2>
<p data-start="1055" data-end="1202">Es probable que tu <code data-start="1074" data-end="1080">PATH</code> esté mal configurado o estés usando un entorno donde los paquetes no se instalan globalmente. En ese caso, te recomiendo:</p>
<h3 data-start="1204" data-end="1245">a) Verificar si Streamlit se instaló:</h3>

<p data-start="1279" data-end="1406">Si <strong data-start="1282" data-end="1301">no aparece nada</strong>, entonces no se instaló.<br data-start="1326" data-end="1329">
Si sí aparece, mira en qué carpeta está y asegúrate de que esté en tu <code data-start="1399" data-end="1405">PATH</code>.</p>
<hr data-start="1408" data-end="1411">
<p data-start="1413" data-end="1575">¿Quieres que prepare un entorno virtual (<code data-start="1454" data-end="1460">venv</code>) paso a paso para aislar el proyecto y asegurarnos de que todo funcione en ese entorno?<br data-start="1548" data-end="1551">
Solo necesitas escribir:</p>
<pre class="overflow-visible!" data-start="1577" data-end="1608"><div class="contain-inline-size rounded-2xl relative bg-token-sidebar-surface-primary"><div class="flex items-center text-token-text-secondary px-4 py-2 text-xs font-sans justify-between h-9 bg-token-sidebar-surface-primary select-none rounded-t-2xl">bash</div><div class="sticky top-9"><div class="absolute end-0 bottom-0 flex h-9 items-center pe-2"><div class="bg-token-bg-elevated-secondary text-token-text-secondary flex items-center gap-4 rounded-sm px-2 font-sans text-xs"><button class="flex gap-1 dir="auto" data-testid="conversation-turn-16" data-scroll-anchor="false" style=""><h6 class="sr-only">ChatGPT Plus</h6><div class="text-base my-auto mx-auto py-5 [--thread-content-margin:--spacing(4)] @[37rem]:[--thread-content-margin:--spacing(6)] @[72rem]:[--thread-content-margin:--spacing(16)] px-(--thread-content-margin)"><div class="[--thread-content-max-width:32rem] @[34rem]:[--thread-content-max-width:40rem] @[64rem]:[--thread-content-max-width:48rem] mx-auto flex max-w-(--thread-content-max-width) flex-1 text-base gap-4 md:gap-5 lg:gap-6 group/turn-messages focus-visible:outline-hidden" tabindex="-1"><div class="group/conversation-turn relative flex w-full min-w-0 flex-col agent-turn"><div class="relative flex-col gap-1 md:gap-3"><div class="flex max-w-full flex-col grow"><div data-message-author-role="assistant" data-message-id="8f7eb23b-c6ab-4fd1-8551-4d8998fccb30" dir="auto" class="min-h-8 text-message relative flex w-full flex-col items-end gap-2 text-start break-words whitespace-normal [.text-message+&amp;]:mt-5" data-message-model-slug="gpt-4o"><div class="flex w-full flex-col gap-1 empty:hidden first:pt-[3px]"><div class="markdown prose dark:prose-invert w-full break-words light"><p data-start="0" data-end="99">¡Genial que ya funcione! 🎉 Que se vea “todo en blanco” normalmente indica una de estas tres cosas:</p>
<hr data-start="101" data-end="104">
<h3 data-start="106" data-end="168">🧩 <strong data-start="113" data-end="168">Causa 1: El navegador se abre pero no hay contenido</strong></h3>
<p data-start="169" data-end="272">Esto suele pasar si hay un <strong data-start="196" data-end="233">error dentro del archivo <code data-start="223" data-end="231">app.py</code></strong> (por ejemplo, en la llamada a la API).</p>
<h4 data-start="274" data-end="291">👉 Solución:</h4>
<ol data-start="292" data-end="409">
<li data-start="292" data-end="355">
<p data-start="295" data-end="355">Vuelve a la consola donde ejecutaste <code data-start="332" data-end="354">streamlit run app.py</code>.</p>
</li>
<li data-start="356" data-end="409">
<p data-start="359" data-end="409">Revisa si aparece un <strong data-start="380" data-end="408">mensaje de error en rojo</strong>.</p>
</li>
</ol>
<p data-start="411" data-end="572">Si lo hay, <strong data-start="422" data-end="445">copia y pégalo aquí</strong> para que te diga exactamente qué está fallando (puede ser algo tan simple como que la API devolvió vacío o falló la conexión).</p>
<hr data-start="574" data-end="577">
<h3 data-start="579" data-end="631">🧩 <strong data-start="586" data-end="631">Causa 2: La app tarda en cargar los datos</strong></h3>
<p data-start="633" data-end="755">Si tu conexión a internet es lenta o la API de Open-Meteo está ocupada, puede tardar varios segundos en mostrar contenido.</p>
<h4 data-start="757" data-end="774">👉 Solución:</h4>
<ul data-start="775" data-end="984">
<li data-start="775" data-end="833">
<p data-start="777" data-end="833">Espera unos segundos (normalmente tarda entre 5 y 15 s).</p>
</li>
<li data-start="834" data-end="877">
<p data-start="836" data-end="877">Revisa que no haya errores en la consola.</p>
</li>
<li data-start="878" data-end="984">
<p data-start="880" data-end="984">Si lo deseas, puedo modificar el código para mostrar un mensaje como “⏳ Cargando datos…” mientras tanto.</p>
</li>
</ul>
<hr data-start="986" data-end="989">
<h3 data-start="991" data-end="1039">🧩 <strong data-start="998" data-end="1039">Causa 3: El navegador no recargó bien</strong></h3>
<p data-start="1041" data-end="1128">A veces, Streamlit lanza la app pero el navegador se queda en blanco por tema de caché.</p>
<h4 data-start="1130" data-end="1147">👉 Solución:</h4>
<ul data-start="1148" data-end="1277">
<li data-start="1148" data-end="1211">
<p data-start="1150" data-end="1211">Prueba a <strong data-start="1159" data-end="1181">recargar la página</strong> en el navegador (<code data-start="1199" data-end="1209">Ctrl + R</code>).</p>
</li>
<li data-start="1212" data-end="1277">
<p data-start="1214" data-end="1241">O accede manualmente desde:</p>
<pre class="overflow-visible!" data-start="1244" data-end="1277"><div class="contain-inline-size rounded-2xl relative bg-token-sidebar-surface-primary"><div class="flex items-center <hr data-start="1279" data-end="1282">
<h3 data-start="1284" data-end="1340">✅ Verificación rápida: añade un mensaje al principio</h3>
<p data-start="1342" data-end="1414">Edita <code data-start="1348" data-end="1356">app.py</code> y pon esto como primera línea después de <code data-start="1398" data-end="1413">st.title(...)</code>:</p>
<pre class="overflow-visible!" data-start="1416" data-end="1483"><div class="contain-inline-size rounded-2xl relative bg-token-sidebar-surface-primary"><div class="flex items-center text-token-text-secondary px-4 py-2 text-xs font-sans justify-between h-9 bg-token-sidebar-surface-primary select-none rounded-t-2xl">python</div><div class="sticky top-9"><div class="absolute end-0 <p data-start="1485" data-end="1551">Si <strong data-start="1488" data-end="1512">esto tampoco aparece</strong>, el archivo ni siquiera está cargando.</p>

max-w-full flex-col grow"><div data-message-author-role="assistant" data-message-id="70044428-2d8d-4b8c-9e70-d35a46049011" dir="auto" class="min-h-8 text-message relative flex w-full flex-col items-end gap-2 text-start break-words whitespace-normal [.text-message+&amp;]:mt-5" data-message-model-slug="gpt-4o"><div class="flex w-full flex-col gap-1 empty:hidden first:pt-[3px]"><div class="markdown prose dark:prose-invert w-full break-words light"><p data-start="0" data-end="188">Perfecto, si esos <code data-start="18" data-end="26">import</code> aparecen <strong data-start="36" data-end="62">subrayados en amarillo</strong>, probablemente estás viendo advertencias del editor (como VS Code o PyCharm), no errores de ejecución. Esto suele significar:</p>
<ul data-start="190" data-end="376">
<li data-start="190" data-end="255">
<p data-start="192" data-end="255">El editor <strong data-start="202" data-end="233">no encuentra esas librerías</strong> en el entorno actual.</p>
</li>
<li data-start="256" data-end="376">
<p data-start="258" data-end="376">Pero <strong data-start="263" data-end="352">tu código puede funcionar igual si ejecutas con otro Python donde sí están instaladas</strong> (como acabas de hacer).</p>
</li>
</ul>
<hr data-start="378" data-end="381">
<h2 data-start="383" data-end="429">✅ ¿Qué significan los subrayados amarillos?</h2>
<div class="_tableContainer_80l1q_1"><div tabindex="-1" class="_tableWrapper_80l1q_14 group flex w-fit flex-col-reverse"><table data-start="431" data-end="840" class="w-fit <h2 data-start="847" data-end="872">🔍 ¿Cómo solucionarlo?</h2>

<blockquote data-start="1097" data-end="1186">
<p data-start="1099" data-end="1186">Esto debería eliminar los subrayados si estás usando el mismo intérprete que el editor.</p>

<p data-start="1612" data-end="1716">Asegúrate de que <strong data-start="1629" data-end="1656">VS Code usa ese entorno</strong> (abajo a la izquierda puedes cambiar el intérprete Python).</p>

@[37rem]:[--thread-content-margin:--spacing(6)] @[72rem]:[--thread-content-margin:--spacing(16)] px-(--thread-content-margin)"><div class="[--thread-content-max-width:32rem] @[34rem]:[--thread-content-max-width:40rem] @[64rem]:[--thread-content-max-width:48rem] mx-auto flex max-w-(--thread-content-max-width) flex-1 text-base gap-4 md:gap-5 lg:gap-6 group/turn-messages ejecución de scripts por razones de seguridad</strong>.</p>
<p data-start="109" data-end="207">Pero no te preocupes: hay varias formas de solucionarlo. Aquí te muestro la más segura y sencilla.</p>
<hr data-start="209" data-end="212">
<h2 data-start="214" data-end="292">✅ Opción 1 (recomendada): Activar entorno usando <code data-start="266" data-end="271">CMD</code> (sí permite scripts)</h2>
<p data-start="294" data-end="356">En lugar de PowerShell, abre el <strong data-start="326" data-end="355">Símbolo del sistema (CMD)</strong>:</p>
<ol data-start="358" data-end="750">
<li data-start="358" data-end="405">
<p data-start="361" data-end="405">Pulsa <code data-start="367" data-end="376">Win + R</code>, escribe <code data-start="386" data-end="391">cmd</code> y pulsa Enter</p>
</li>
<li data-start="406" data-end="502">

</li>
</ol>
<hr data-start="752" data-end="755">
<h2 data-start="757" data-end="830">🛠️ Opción 2 (alternativa): Permitir scripts <strong data-start="805" data-end="830">solo para esta sesión</strong></h2>
<blockquote data-start="832" data-end="891">
<p data-start="834" data-end="891">⚠️ Haz esto solo si confías en tu propio código y entorno</p>

<p data-start="1260" data-end="1381">Esto permite la ejecución de cualquier script local y firmado. Solo recomendable si sabes lo que haces y es tu propio PC.</p>

class="text-token-text-primary w-full" dir="auto" data-testid="conversation-turn-21" data-scroll-anchor="false" style="scroll-margin-top: -3316px;"><h5 class="sr-only">Tú dijiste:</h5><div class="text-base my-auto mx-auto py-5 [--thread-content-margin:--spacing(4)] @[37rem]:[--thread-content-margin:--spacing(6)] @[72rem]:[--thread-content-margin:--spacing(16)] max-w-(--thread-content-max-width) flex-1 text-base gap-4 md:gap-5 lg:gap-6 group/turn-messages focus-visible:outline-hidden" tabindex="-1"><div class="group/conversation-turn relative flex w-full empty:hidden items-end rtl:items-start"><div class="relative max-w-[var(--user-chat-width,70%)] bg-token-message-surface rounded-3xl px-5 py-2.5"><div class="whitespace-pre-wrap">ya lo solucione pero sigue sin salir nada este es  el codigoimport streamlit as st
import requests
import pandas as pd
import plotly.express as px
from datetime import datetime, timedelta

# Coordenadas de los spots de surf
SPOTS = {
    "La Cícer": (28.1288, -15.4391),
    "El Confital": (28.1441, -15.4340),
    "La Laja": (28.0747, -15.4123),
    "San Andrés": (28.1346, -15.4612),
}

# Funciones auxiliares para obtener datos de Open-Meteo
def get_wave_data(lat, lon, start_date, end_date):
    url = "https://marine-api.open-meteo.com/v1/marine"
    params = {
        "latitude": lat,
        "longitude": lon,
        "hourly": ",".join([
            "wave_height",
            "wave_direction",
            "wave_period",
            "wind_speed",
            "wind_direction",
            "sea_surface_temperature"
        ]),
        "start_date": start_date,
        "end_date": end_date,
        "timezone": "auto"
    }
    response = requests.get(url, params=params)
    data = response.json()
    df = pd.DataFrame(data["hourly"])
    df["time"] = pd.to_datetime(df["time"])
    return df

# Interfaz de Streamlit
st.set_page_config(page_title="Surf Dashboard - Canarias", layout="wide")
st.title("🏄 Surf Dashboard - Spots de Gran Canaria")

spot_name = st.selectbox("Selecciona un spot de surf:", list(SPOTS.keys()))
lat, lon = SPOTS[spot_name]

# Fechas para obtener datos actuales y de los últimos 3 días
hoy = datetime.utcnow().date()
ayer = hoy - timedelta(days=1)
antier = hoy - timedelta(days=2)
inicio = antier.strftime("%Y-%m-%d")
fin = (hoy + timedelta(days=1)).strftime("%Y-%m-%d")

# Obtener datos de Open-Meteo
data = get_wave_data(lat, lon, inicio, fin)

# Mostrar resumen actual
st.subheader(f"Condiciones actuales en {spot_name}")
actual = data.iloc[-1]
col1, col2, col3 = st.columns(3)
col1.metric("Altura de ola", f"{actual['wave_height']:.2f} m")
col2.metric("Viento", f"{actual['wind_speed']:.1f} km/h")
col3.metric("Temp. del mar", f"{actual['sea_surface_temperature']:.1f} °C")

# Mostrar gráficos
st.subheader("📈 Evolución de las condiciones marinas (72h)")
fig1 = px.line(data, x="time", y="wave_height", title="Altura de las olas (m)")
fig2 = px.line(data, x="time", y="wave_period", title="Periodo de las olas (s)")
fig3 = px.line(data, x="time", y="wind_speed", title="Velocidad del viento (km/h)")

st.plotly_chart(fig1, use_container_width=True)
st.plotly_chart(fig2, use_container_width=True)
st.plotly_chart(fig3, use_container_width=True)

st.caption("Datos obtenidos desde la API de Open-Meteo: https://open-meteo.com")

Que no salga nada visible puede deberse a que los datos que devuelve la API están vacíos o con valores <code data-start="173" data-end="178">NaN</code>, o que la API no está respondiendo como esperamos.</p>
<p data-start="231" data-end="319">Vamos a hacer algunas comprobaciones y mejoras para diagnosticar y arreglar el problema:</p>
<hr data-start="321" data-end="324">
<h2 data-start="326" data-end="391">1. Añade impresión del JSON recibido para ver qué datos llegan</h2>
<p data-start="393" data-end="482">Modifica la función <code data-start="413" data-end="428">get_wave_data</code> para imprimir el JSON (o al menos la clave <code data-start="472" data-end="480">hourly</code>):</p>

4.22517 12.6732 4.3584 12.3096L4.45117 12.0791C4.55073 11.8521 4.67152 11.6346 4.81152 11.4297L4.9873 11.1953C5.17772 10.9632 5.4146 10.728 5.73828 10.4043L12.0303 4.11328ZM6.67871 11.3447C6.32926 11.6942 6.14542 11.8803 6.01953 12.0332L5.90918 12.1797C5.81574 12.3165 5.73539 12.4618 5.66895 12.6133L5.60742 12.7666C5.52668 12.9869 5.48332 13.229 5.375 13.8789L4.97656 16.2725L4.97559 4.28711C7.27713 4.3114 7.38267 4.43665 7.38281 4.58301C7.38281 4.7295 7.27723 4.8546 7.13281 4.87891C6.44249 4.99401 5.94116 5.27746 5.58398 5.66211C5.26908 6.00126 5.05404 6.43267 4.92676 6.92676L4.87695 7.1416C4.84891 7.28183 4.72601 7.38281 4.58301 7.38281C4.44013 7.38267 4.31709 7.28173 4.28906 7.1416C4.17212 6.55728 3.94179 6.04956 3.58203 5.66211C3.22483 5.27757 2.72347 4.99395 2.0332 4.87891C1.88897 4.85446 1.7832 4.72938 1.7832 4.58301C1.78335 4.43673 1.88902 4.3115 2.0332 4.28711C2.72366 4.17203 3.22481 3.88861 3.58203 3.50391C3.94186 3.11638 4.17214 2.60888 4.28906 2.02441L4.30371 1.97363C4.34801 1.86052 4.45804 1.78333 4.58301 1.7832Z"></path></svg>Editar</button></span></div></div></div><div class="overflow-y-auto p-4" dir="ltr"><code class="whitespace-pre! language-python"><span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">def</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-title function_">get_wave_data</span></span><span>(</span><span><span class="hljs-params">lat, lon, start_date, end_date</span></span><span>):
    url = </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"https://marine-api.open-meteo.com/v1/marine"</span></span><span>
    params = {
        </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"latitude"</span></span><span>: lat,
        </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"longitude"</span></span><span>: lon,
        </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"hourly"</span></span><span>: </span><span><span class="hljs-string">","</span></span><span>.join([
            </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"wave_height"</span></span><span>,
            </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"wave_direction"</span></span><span>,
            </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"wave_period"</span></span><span>,
            </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"wind_speed"</span></span><span>,
            </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"wind_direction"</span></span><span>,
            </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"sea_surface_temperature"</span></span><span>
        ]),
        </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"start_date"</span></span><span>: start_date,
        </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"end_date"</span></span><span>: end_date,
        </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"timezone"</span></span><span>: </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"auto"</span></span><span>
    }
    response = requests.get(url, params=params)
    data = response.json()
    st.write(</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"Datos crudos API:"</span></span><span>, data)  </span><span><span class="hljs-comment"># Mostrar en Streamlit lo que recibimos</span></span><span>
    </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">if</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"hourly"</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">not</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">in</span></span><span> data:
        st.error(</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"No se encontraron datos horarios en la respuesta de la API."</span></span><span>)
        </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">return</span></span><span> pd.DataFrame()  </span><span><span class="hljs-comment"># Devuelve df vacío</span></span><span>
    df = pd.DataFrame(data[</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"hourly"</span></span><span>])
    </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">if</span></span><span> df.empty:
        st.warning(</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"El DataFrame está vacío."</span></span><span>)
    </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">else</span></span><span>:
        df[</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"time"</span></span><span>] = pd.to_datetime(df[</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"time"</span></span><span>])
    </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">return</span></span><span> df
</span></span></code></div></div></pre>
<p data-start="1478" data-end="1554">Esto te mostrará si la API está respondiendo con datos o si hay algún error.</p>
<hr data-start="1556" data-end="1559">
<h2 data-start="1561" data-end="1608">2. Controla el caso en que <code data-start="1591" data-end="1597">data</code> esté vacío</h2>
<p data-start="1610" data-end="1678">Después de obtener los datos, comprueba si el DataFrame tiene filas:</p>
<pre class="overflow-visible!" data-start="1680" data-end="2651"><div class="contain-inline-size rounded-2xl relative bg-token-sidebar-surface-primary"><div class="flex items-center text-token-text-secondary px-4 py-2 text-xs font-sans justify-between h-9 bg-token-sidebar-surface-primary select-none rounded-t-2xl">python</div><div class="sticky top-9"><div class="absolute end-0 language-python"><span><span>data = get_wave_data(lat, lon, inicio, fin)

</span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">if</span></span><span> data.empty:
    st.warning(</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"No se han encontrado datos para las fechas seleccionadas y el spot."</span></span><span>)
</span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">else</span></span><span>:
    </span><span><span class="hljs-comment"># Mostrar resumen actual</span></span><span>
    actual = data.iloc[-</span><span><span class="hljs-number">1</span></span><span>]
    col1, col2, col3 = st.columns(</span><span><span class="hljs-number">3</span></span><span>)
    col1.metric(</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"Altura de ola"</span></span><span>, </span><span><span class="hljs-string">f"<span class="hljs-subst">{actual[<span class="hljs-string">'wave_height'</span></span></span></span><span>]:</span><span><span class="hljs-number">.2</span></span><span>f} m")
    col2.metric(</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"Viento"</span></span><span>, </span><span><span class="hljs-string">f"<span class="hljs-subst">{actual[<span class="hljs-string">'wind_speed'</span></span></span></span><span>]:</span><span><span class="hljs-number">.1</span></span><span>f} km/h")
    col3.metric(</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"Temp. del mar"</span></span><span>, </span><span><span class="hljs-string">f"<span class="hljs-subst">{actual[<span class="hljs-string">'sea_surface_temperature'</span></span></span></span><span>]:</span><span><span class="hljs-number">.1</span></span><span>f} °C")

    </span><span><span class="hljs-comment"># Mostrar gráficos</span></span><span>
    st.subheader(</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"📈 Evolución de las condiciones marinas (72h)"</span></span><span>)
    fig1 = px.line(data, x=</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"time"</span></span><span>, y=</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"wave_height"</span></span><span>, title=</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"Altura de las olas (m)"</span></span><span>)
    fig2 = px.line(data, x=</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"time"</span></span><span>, y=</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"wave_period"</span></span><span>, title=</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"Periodo de las olas (s)"</span></span><span>)
    fig3 = px.line(data, x=</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"time"</span></span><span>, y=</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"wind_speed"</span></span><span>, title=</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"Velocidad del viento (km/h)"</span></span><span>)

    st.plotly_chart(fig1, use_container_width=</span><span><span class="hljs-literal">True</span></span><span>)
    st.plotly_chart(fig2, use_container_width=</span><span><span class="hljs-literal">True</span></span><span>)
    st.plotly_chart(fig3, use_container_width=</span><span><span class="hljs-literal">True</span></span><span>)
</span></span></code></div></div></pre>
<hr data-start="2653" data-end="2656">
<h2 data-start="2658" data-end="2679">3. Posibles causas</h2>
<ul data-start="2681" data-end="2978">
<li data-start="2681" data-end="2857">
<p data-start="2683" data-end="2857"><strong data-start="2683" data-end="2709">Fechas fuera de rango:</strong> Es posible que la API no tenga datos históricos para los días que estás pidiendo. Prueba a poner fechas más recientes o solo el día actual (<code data-start="2850" data-end="2855">hoy</code>).</p>
</li>
<li data-start="2859" data-end="2978">
<p data-start="2861" data-end="2978"><strong data-start="2861" data-end="2886">Parámetros de la API:</strong> Verifica que los parámetros sean correctos. Open-Meteo suele cambiar la API con frecuencia.</p>
</li>
</ul>
<hr data-start="2980" data-end="2983">
<h2 data-start="2985" data-end="3032">4. Prueba rápida: solo datos de hoy y mañana</h2>
<p data-start="3034" data-end="3128">Cambia las fechas así para asegurarte de que pides solo datos actuales y futuros (predicción):</p>

5.25395 18.1657 4.80371 18.1289C4.40306 18.0962 4.04235 18.031 3.70606 17.8867L3.56348 17.8203C3.04244 17.5548 2.60585 17.151 2.30176 16.6553L2.17969 16.4365C1.98788 16.0599 1.90851 15.6541 1.87109 4.04235 18.0962 4.40306 18.1289 4.80371C18.1657 5.25395 18.165 5.81091 18.165 6.5V9.33301Z"></path></svg>Copiar</button><span class="" data-state="closed"><button class="flex items-center gap-1 py-1 select-none"><svg width="20" height="20" viewBox="0 0 20 20" fill="currentColor" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" class="icon-xs"><path d="M12.0303 4.11328C13.4406 2.70317 15.7275 2.70305 17.1377 4.11328C18.5474 5.52355 18.5476 7.81057 17.1377 9.2207L10.8457 15.5117C10.522 15.8354 10.2868 16.0723 10.0547 16.2627L9.82031 16.4395C9.61539 16.5794 9.39783 16.7003 9.1709 16.7998L8.94141 17.5703C4.02415 17.4746 3.84119 17.3068 3.72559 17.0957L3.67969 17.0029C3.59322 16.8013 3.59553 16.6073 3.60547 16.4756C3.61519 16.3473 3.6403 16.1963 3.66406 16.0537L4.06348 13.6602C4.1638 13.0582 4.22517 12.6732 4.3584 12.3096L4.45117 12.0791C4.55073 11.8521 4.67152 11.6346 4.81152 11.4297L4.9873 11.1953C5.17772 10.9632 5.4146 10.728 5.73828 10.4043L12.0303 4.11328ZM6.67871 11.3447C6.32926 11.6942 6.14542 11.8803 6.01953 12.0332L5.90918 12.1797C5.81574 12.3165 5.73539 12.4618 5.66895 12.6133L5.60742 12.7666C5.52668 12.9869 5.48332 13.229 5.375 13.8789L4.97656 16.2725L4.97559 16.2744H4.97852L7.37207 15.875L8.08887 15.749C8.25765 15.7147 8.37336 15.6839 8.4834 15.6436L8.63672 15.5811C8.78817 15.5146 8.93356 15.4342 9.07031 15.3408L9.2168 15.2305C9.36965 15.1046 9.55583 17.0869 5.94456 16.1963 5.05371Z"></path><path d="M4.58301 1.7832C4.72589 1.7832 4.84877 1.88437 4.87695 2.02441C4.99384 2.60873 5.22432 3.11642 5.58398 3.50391C5.94115 3.88854 6.44253 4.172 7.13281 4.28711C7.27713 4.3114 7.38267 4.43665 7.38281 4.58301C7.38281 4.7295 7.27723 4.8546 7.13281 4.87891C6.44249 4.99401 5.94116 5.27746 5.58398 5.66211C5.26908 6.00126 5.05404 6.43267 4.92676 6.92676L4.87695 7.1416C4.84891 7.28183 4.72601 7.38281 4.58301 7.38281C4.44013 7.38267 4.31709 7.28173 4.28906 7.1416C4.17212 6.55728 3.94179 6.04956 3.58203 5.66211C3.22483 5.27757 2.72347 4.99395 2.0332 4.87891C1.88897 4.85446 1.7832 4.72938 1.7832 4.58301C1.78335 4.43673 1.88902 4.3115 2.0332 4.28711C2.72366 4.17203 3.22481 3.88861 3.58203 3.50391C3.94186 3.11638 4.17214 2.60888 4.28906 2.02441L4.30371 1.97363C4.34801 1.86052 4.45804 1.78333 4.58301 1.7832Z"></path></svg>Editar</button></span></div></div></div><div class="overflow-y-auto p-4" dir="ltr"><code class="whitespace-pre! language-python"><span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">import</span></span><span> streamlit </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">as</span></span><span> st
</span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">import</span></span><span> requests
</span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">import</span></span><span> pandas </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">as</span></span><span> pd
</span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">import</span></span><span> plotly.express </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">as</span></span><span> px
</span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">from</span></span><span> datetime </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">import</span></span><span> datetime, timedelta

</span><span><span class="hljs-comment"># Coordenadas de los spots de surf</span></span><span>
SPOTS = {
    </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"La Cícer"</span></span><span>: (</span><span><span class="hljs-number">28.1288</span></span><span>, -</span><span><span class="hljs-number">15.4391</span></span><span>),
    </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"El Confital"</span></span><span>: (</span><span><span class="hljs-number">28.1441</span></span><span>, -</span><span><span class="hljs-number">15.4340</span></span><span>),
    </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"La Laja"</span></span><span>: (</span><span><span class="hljs-number">28.0747</span></span><span>, -</span><span><span class="hljs-number">15.4123</span></span><span>),
    </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"San Andrés"</span></span><span>: (</span><span><span class="hljs-number">28.1346</span></span><span>, -</span><span><span class="hljs-number">15.4612</span></span><span>),
}

</span><span><span class="hljs-comment"># Función para obtener datos de Open-Meteo</span></span><span>
</span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">def</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-title function_">get_wave_data</span></span><span>(</span><span><span class="hljs-params">lat, lon, start_date, end_date</span></span><span>):
    url = </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"https://marine-api.open-meteo.com/v1/marine"</span></span><span>
    params = {
        </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"latitude"</span></span><span>: lat,
        </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"longitude"</span></span><span>: lon,
        </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"hourly"</span></span><span>: </span><span><span class="hljs-string">","</span></span><span>.join([
            </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"wave_height"</span></span><span>,
            </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"wave_direction"</span></span><span>,
            </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"wave_period"</span></span><span>,
            </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"wind_speed"</span></span><span>,
            </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"wind_direction"</span></span><span>,
            </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"sea_surface_temperature"</span></span><span>
        ]),
        </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"start_date"</span></span><span>: start_date,
        </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"end_date"</span></span><span>: end_date,
        </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"timezone"</span></span><span>: </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"auto"</span></span><span>
    }
    response = requests.get(url, params=params)
    data = response.json()
    st.write(</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"Datos crudos API:"</span></span><span>, data)  </span><span><span class="hljs-comment"># Mostrar datos crudos para debug</span></span><span>
    </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">if</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"hourly"</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">not</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">in</span></span><span> data:
        st.error(</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"No se encontraron datos horarios en la respuesta de la API."</span></span><span>)
        </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">return</span></span><span> pd.DataFrame()
    df = pd.DataFrame(data[</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"hourly"</span></span><span>])
    </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">if</span></span><span> df.empty:
        st.warning(</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"El DataFrame está vacío."</span></span><span>)
    </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">else</span></span><span>:
        df[</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"time"</span></span><span>] = pd.to_datetime(df[</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"time"</span></span><span>])
    </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">return</span></span><span> df

</span><span><span class="hljs-comment"># Interfaz Streamlit</span></span><span>
st.set_page_config(page_title=</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"Surf Dashboard - Canarias"</span></span><span>, layout=</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"wide"</span></span><span>)
st.title(</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"🏄 Surf Dashboard - Spots de Gran Canaria"</span></span><span>)

spot_name = st.selectbox(</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"Selecciona un spot de surf:"</span></span><span>, </span><span><span class="hljs-built_in">list</span></span><span>(SPOTS.keys()))
lat, lon = SPOTS[spot_name]

</span><span><span class="hljs-comment"># Fechas: solo hoy y mañana para asegurar datos disponibles</span></span><span>
hoy = datetime.utcnow().date()
inicio = hoy.strftime(</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"%Y-%m-%d"</span></span><span>)
fin = (hoy + timedelta(days=</span><span><span class="hljs-number">1</span></span><span>)).strftime(</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"%Y-%m-%d"</span></span><span>)

</span><span><span class="hljs-comment"># Obtener datos</span></span><span>
data = get_wave_data(lat, lon, inicio, fin)

</span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">if</span></span><span> data.empty:
    st.warning(</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"No se han encontrado datos para las fechas seleccionadas y el spot."</span></span><span>)
</span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">else</span></span><span>:
    </span><span><span class="hljs-comment"># Mostrar resumen actual</span></span><span>
    actual = data.iloc[-</span><span><span class="hljs-number">1</span></span><span>]
    col1, col2, col3 = st.columns(</span><span><span class="hljs-number">3</span></span><span>)
    col1.metric(</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"Altura de ola"</span></span><span>, </span><span><span class="hljs-string">f"<span class="hljs-subst">{actual[<span class="hljs-string">'wave_height'</span></span></span></span><span>]:</span><span><span class="hljs-number">.2</span></span><span>f} m")
    col2.metric(</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"Viento"</span></span><span>, </span><span><span class="hljs-string">f"<span class="hljs-subst">{actual[<span class="hljs-string">'wind_speed'</span></span></span></span><span>]:</span><span><span class="hljs-number">.1</span></span><span>f} km/h")
    col3.metric(</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"Temp. del mar"</span></span><span>, </span><span><span class="hljs-string">f"<span class="hljs-subst">{actual[<span class="hljs-string">'sea_surface_temperature'</span></span></span></span><span>]:</span><span><span class="hljs-number">.1</span></span><span>f} °C")

    </span><span><span class="hljs-comment"># Mostrar gráficos</span></span><span>
    st.subheader(</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"📈 Evolución de las condiciones marinas (48h)"</span></span><span>)
    fig1 = px.line(data, x=</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"time"</span></span><span>, y=</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"wave_height"</span></span><span>, title=</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"Altura de las olas (m)"</span></span><span>)
    fig2 = px.line(data, x=</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"time"</span></span><span>, y=</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"wave_period"</span></span><span>, title=</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"Periodo de las olas (s)"</span></span><span>)
    fig3 = px.line(data, x=</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"time"</span></span><span>, y=</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"wind_speed"</span></span><span>, title=</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"Velocidad del viento (km/h)"</span></span><span>)

    st.plotly_chart(fig1, use_container_width=</span><span><span class="hljs-literal">True</span></span><span>)
    st.plotly_chart(fig2, use_container_width=</span><span><span class="hljs-literal">True</span></span><span>)
    st.plotly_chart(fig3, use_container_width=</span><span><span class="hljs-literal">True</span></span><span>)

st.caption(</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"Datos obtenidos desde la API de Open-Meteo: https://open-meteo.com"</span></span><span>)
</span></span></code></div></div></pre>
<hr data-start="3099" data-end="3102">
<h3 data-start="3104" data-end="3119">¿Qué hacer?</h3>
<ul data-start="3121" data-end="3323">
<li data-start="3121" data-end="3235">
<p data-start="3123" data-end="3235">Ejecuta la app con este código y fíjate en la salida de <code data-start="3179" data-end="3200">"Datos crudos API:"</code> para entender qué devuelve la API.</p>
</li>
<li data-start="3236" data-end="3323">
<p data-start="3238" data-end="3323">Si te sale algo extraño o sin datos, mándame esa parte para ayudarte a interpretarla.</p>
</li>
</ul>
<p data-start="3325" data-end="3437" data-is-last-node="" data-is-only-node="">¿Quieres que también te prepare cómo añadir el mapa interactivo con esos spots para que lo integres en esta app?</p></div></div></div></div><div class="flex min-h-[46px] justify-start"><div class="touch:-me-2 touch:-ms-3.5 -ms-2.5 -me-1 flex flex-wrap items-center gap-y-4 p-1 select-none <p data-start="368" data-end="451">Esto crea un objeto <code data-start="388" data-end="398">datetime</code> con zona horaria UTC, y luego sacamos solo la fecha.</p>
<hr data-start="453" data-end="456">
<h3 data-start="458" data-end="479">Código corregido:</h3>

dir="auto" data-testid="conversation-turn-28" data-scroll-anchor="false" style=""><h6 class="sr-only">ChatGPT Plus</h6><div class="text-base my-auto mx-auto py-5 [--thread-content-margin:--spacing(4)] @[37rem]:[--thread-content-margin:--spacing(6)] @[72rem]:[--thread-content-margin:--spacing(16)] px-(--thread-content-margin)"><div class="[--thread-content-max-width:32rem] @[34rem]:[--thread-content-max-width:40rem] @[64rem]:[--thread-content-max-width:48rem] mx-auto flex max-w-(--thread-content-max-width) flex-1 text-base gap-4 md:gap-5 lg:gap-6 group/turn-messages select-none"><svg width="20" height="20" viewBox="0 0 20 20" fill="currentColor" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" class="icon-xs"><path d="M12.0303 4.11328C13.4406 2.70317 15.7275 2.70305 17.1377 4.11328C18.5474 5.52355 18.5476 7.81057 17.1377 9.2207L10.8457 15.5117C10.522 15.8354 10.2868 16.0723 10.0547 16.2627L9.82031 16.4395C9.61539 16.5794 9.39783 16.7003 9.1709 16.7998L8.94141 4.22517 12.6732 4.3584 12.3096L4.45117 12.0791C4.55073 11.8521 4.67152 11.6346 4.81152 11.4297L4.9873 11.1953C5.17772 10.9632 5.4146 10.728 5.73828 10.4043L12.0303 4.11328ZM6.67871 11.3447C6.32926 11.6942 6.14542 11.8803 6.01953 12.0332L5.90918 12.1797C5.81574 12.3165 5.73539 12.4618 5.66895 12.6133L5.60742 12.7666C5.52668 12.9869 5.48332 13.229 5.375 13.8789L4.97656 16.2725L4.97559 16.2744H4.97852L7.37207 15.875L8.08887 15.749C8.25765 15.7147 8.37336 15.6839 8.4834 15.6436L8.63672 15.5811C8.78817 15.5146 8.93356 15.4342 9.07031 15.3408L9.2168 15.2305C9.36965 15.1046 9.55583 14.9207 9.90527 14.5713L14.8926 9.58301L11.666 6.35742L6.67871 11.3447ZM16.1963 5.05371C15.3054 4.16304 13.8616 4.16305 12.9707 5.05371L12.6074 5.41602L15.833 8.64258L16.1963 8.2793C17.0869 7.38845 17.0869 5.94456 16.1963 5.05371Z"></path><path d="M4.58301 1.7832C4.72589 1.7832 4.84877 1.88437 4.87695 2.02441C4.99384 2.60873 5.22432 3.11642 5.58398 3.50391C5.94115 3.88854 6.44253 4.172 7.13281 4.28711C7.27713 4.3114 7.38267 4.43665 7.38281 4.58301C7.38281 4.7295 7.27723 4.8546 7.13281 4.87891C6.44249 4.99401 5.94116 5.27746 5.58398 5.66211C5.26908 6.00126 5.05404 6.43267 4.92676 6.92676L4.87695 7.1416C4.84891 7.28183 4.72601 7.38281 4.58301 7.38281C4.44013 7.38267 4.31709 7.28173 4.28906 7.1416C4.17212 6.55728 3.94179 6.04956 3.58203 5.66211C3.22483 5.27757 2.72347 4.99395 2.0332 4.87891C1.88897 4.85446 1.7832 4.72938 1.7832 4.58301C1.78335 4.43673 1.88902 4.3115 2.0332 4.28711C2.72366 4.17203 3.22481 3.88861 3.58203 3.50391C3.94186 3.11638 4.17214 2.60888 4.28906 2.02441L4.30371 1.97363C4.34801 1.86052 4.45804 1.78333 4.58301 1.7832Z"></path></svg>Editar</button></span></div></div></div><div class="overflow-y-auto p-4" dir="ltr"><code class="whitespace-pre! language-python"><span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">import</span></span><span> streamlit </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">as</span></span><span> st
</span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">import</span></span><span> requests
</span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">import</span></span><span> pandas </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">as</span></span><span> pd
</span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">import</span></span><span> plotly.express </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">as</span></span><span> px
</span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">from</span></span><span> datetime </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">import</span></span><span> datetime, timedelta, timezone

</span><span><span class="hljs-comment"># Coordenadas de los spots de surf</span></span><span>
SPOTS = {
    </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"La Cícer"</span></span><span>: (</span><span><span class="hljs-number">28.1288</span></span><span>, -</span><span><span class="hljs-number">15.4391</span></span><span>),
    </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"El Confital"</span></span><span>: (</span><span><span class="hljs-number">28.1441</span></span><span>, -</span><span><span class="hljs-number">15.4340</span></span><span>),
    </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"La Laja"</span></span><span>: (</span><span><span class="hljs-number">28.0747</span></span><span>, -</span><span><span class="hljs-number">15.4123</span></span><span>),
    </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"San Andrés"</span></span><span>: (</span><span><span class="hljs-number">28.1346</span></span><span>, -</span><span><span class="hljs-number">15.4612</span></span><span>),
}

</span><span><span class="hljs-comment"># Función para obtener datos de Open-Meteo</span></span><span>
</span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">def</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-title function_">get_wave_data</span></span><span>(</span><span><span class="hljs-params">lat, lon, start_date, end_date</span></span><span>):
    url = </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"https://marine-api.open-meteo.com/v1/marine"</span></span><span>
    params = {
        </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"latitude"</span></span><span>: lat,
        </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"longitude"</span></span><span>: lon,
        </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"hourly"</span></span><span>: </span><span><span class="hljs-string">","</span></span><span>.join([
            </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"wave_height"</span></span><span>,
            </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"wave_direction"</span></span><span>,
            </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"wave_period"</span></span><span>,
            </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"wind_speed"</span></span><span>,
            </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"wind_direction"</span></span><span>,
            </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"sea_surface_temperature"</span></span><span>
        ]),
        </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"start_date"</span></span><span>: start_date,
        </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"end_date"</span></span><span>: end_date,
        </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"timezone"</span></span><span>: </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"auto"</span></span><span>
    }
    response = requests.get(url, params=params)
    data = response.json()
    st.write(</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"Datos crudos API:"</span></span><span>, data)  </span><span><span class="hljs-comment"># Mostrar datos crudos para debug</span></span><span>
    </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">if</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"hourly"</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">not</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">in</span></span><span> data:
        st.error(</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"No se encontraron datos horarios en la respuesta de la API."</span></span><span>)
        </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">return</span></span><span> pd.DataFrame()
    df = pd.DataFrame(data[</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"hourly"</span></span><span>])
    </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">if</span></span><span> df.empty:
        st.warning(</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"El DataFrame está vacío."</span></span><span>)
    </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">else</span></span><span>:
        df[</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"time"</span></span><span>] = pd.to_datetime(df[</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"time"</span></span><span>])
    </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">return</span></span><span> df

</span><span><span class="hljs-comment"># Interfaz Streamlit</span></span><span>
st.set_page_config(page_title=</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"Surf Dashboard - Canarias"</span></span><span>, layout=</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"wide"</span></span><span>)
st.title(</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"🏄 Surf Dashboard - Spots de Gran Canaria"</span></span><span>)

spot_name = st.selectbox(</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"Selecciona un spot de surf:"</span></span><span>, </span><span><span class="hljs-built_in">list</span></span><span>(SPOTS.keys()))
lat, lon = SPOTS[spot_name]

</span><span><span class="hljs-comment"># Fechas: solo hoy y mañana para asegurar datos disponibles</span></span><span>
hoy = datetime.now(timezone.utc).date()
inicio = hoy.strftime(</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"%Y-%m-%d"</span></span><span>)
fin = (hoy + timedelta(days=</span><span><span class="hljs-number">1</span></span><span>)).strftime(</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"%Y-%m-%d"</span></span><span>)

</span><span><span class="hljs-comment"># Obtener datos</span></span><span>
data = get_wave_data(lat, lon, inicio, fin)

</span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">if</span></span><span> data.empty:
    st.warning(</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"No se han encontrado datos para las fechas seleccionadas y el spot."</span></span><span>)
</span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">else</span></span><span>:
    </span><span><span class="hljs-comment"># Mostrar resumen actual</span></span><span>
    actual = data.iloc[-</span><span><span class="hljs-number">1</span></span><span>]
    col1, col2, col3 = st.columns(</span><span><span class="hljs-number">3</span></span><span>)
    col1.metric(</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"Altura de ola"</span></span><span>, </span><span><span class="hljs-string">f"<span class="hljs-subst">{actual[<span class="hljs-string">'wave_height'</span></span></span></span><span>]:</span><span><span class="hljs-number">.2</span></span><span>f} m")
    col2.metric(</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"Viento"</span></span><span>, </span><span><span class="hljs-string">f"<span class="hljs-subst">{actual[<span class="hljs-string">'wind_speed'</span></span></span></span><span>]:</span><span><span class="hljs-number">.1</span></span><span>f} km/h")
    col3.metric(</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"Temp. del mar"</span></span><span>, </span><span><span class="hljs-string">f"<span class="hljs-subst">{actual[<span class="hljs-string">'sea_surface_temperature'</span></span></span></span><span>]:</span><span><span class="hljs-number">.1</span></span><span>f} °C")

    </span><span><span class="hljs-comment"># Mostrar gráficos</span></span><span>
    st.subheader(</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"📈 Evolución de las condiciones marinas (48h)"</span></span><span>)
    fig1 = px.line(data, x=</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"time"</span></span><span>, y=</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"wave_height"</span></span><span>, title=</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"Altura de las olas (m)"</span></span><span>)
    fig2 = px.line(data, x=</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"time"</span></span><span>, y=</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"wave_period"</span></span><span>, title=</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"Periodo de las olas (s)"</span></span><span>)
    fig3 = px.line(data, x=</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"time"</span></span><span>, y=</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"wind_speed"</span></span><span>, title=</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"Velocidad del viento (km/h)"</span></span><span>)

    st.plotly_chart(fig1, use_container_width=</span><span><span class="hljs-literal">True</span></span><span>)
    st.plotly_chart(fig2, use_container_width=</span><span><span class="hljs-literal">True</span></span><span>)
    st.plotly_chart(fig3, use_container_width=</span><span><span class="hljs-literal">True</span></span><span>)

st.caption(</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"Datos obtenidos desde la API de Open-Meteo: https://open-meteo.com"</span></span><span>)
</span></span></code></div></div></pre>
<p data-start="2962" data-end="3033">Solo reemplaza el contenido de tu <code data-start="2996" data-end="3004">app.py</code> con este y ejecuta de nuevo.</p>

14.9207 9.90527 14.5713L14.8926 9.58301L11.666 6.35742L6.67871 11.3447ZM16.1963 5.05371C15.3054 4.16304 13.8616 4.16305 12.9707 5.05371L12.6074 5.41602L15.833 8.64258L16.1963 8.2793C17.0869 7.38845 17.0869 5.94456 16.1963 5.05371Z"></path><path d="M4.58301 1.7832C4.72589 1.7832 4.84877 1.88437 4.87695 2.02441C4.99384 2.60873 5.22432 3.11642 5.58398 3.50391C5.94115 3.88854 6.44253 4.172 7.13281 4.28711C7.27713 4.3114 7.38267 4.43665 7.38281 4.58301C7.38281 4.7295 7.27723 4.8546 7.13281 4.87891C6.44249 4.99401 5.94116 5.27746 5.58398 5.66211C5.26908 6.00126 5.05404 6.43267 4.92676 6.92676L4.87695 7.1416C4.84891 7.28183 4.72601 7.38281 4.58301 7.38281C4.44013 7.38267 4.31709 7.28173 4.28906 7.1416C4.17212 6.55728 3.94179 6.04956 3.58203 5.66211C3.22483 5.27757 2.72347 4.99395 2.0332 4.87891C1.88897 4.85446 1.7832 4.72938 1.7832 4.58301C1.78335 4.43673 1.88902 4.3115 2.0332 4.28711C2.72366 4.17203 3.22481 3.88861 3.58203 3.50391C3.94186 3.11638 4.17214 2.60888 4.28906 2.02441L4.30371 1.97363C4.34801 1.86052 4.45804 1.78333 4.58301 1.7832Z"></path></svg>Editar</button></span></div></div></div><div class="overflow-y-auto p-4" dir="ltr"><code class="whitespace-pre! language-json"><span><span><span class="hljs-punctuation">{</span></span><span><span class="hljs-attr">"reason"</span></span><span><span class="hljs-punctuation">:</span></span><span><span class="hljs-string">"Data corrupted at path ''. Cannot initialize MarineVariable from invalid String value wave_height,wave_direction,wave_period,wind_speed,wind_direction,sea_surface_temperature."</span></span><span><span class="hljs-punctuation">,</span></span><span><span class="hljs-attr">"error"</span></span><span><span class="hljs-punctuation">:</span></span><span><span class="hljs-literal"><span class="hljs-keyword">true</span></span></span><span></span><span><span class="hljs-punctuation">}</span></span><span>
</span></span></code></div></div></pre>
<p data-start="238" data-end="361">indica que la API de Open-Meteo no reconoce la cadena que estás enviando en el parámetro <code data-start="327" data-end="335">hourly</code> para los datos marinos.</p>
<hr data-start="363" data-end="366">
<h1 data-start="368" data-end="382">¿Qué ocurre?</h1>
<p data-start="384" data-end="562"><strong data-start="384" data-end="489">La API de marine (<a data-start="404" data-end="447" rel="noopener" target="_new" class="" href="https://marine-api.open-meteo.com/v1/marine">https://marine-api.open-meteo.com/v1/marine</a>) no admite todos esos parámetros juntos</strong>, o quizá algunos nombres de variables están mal o no se pueden combinar.</p>
<hr data-start="564" data-end="567">
<h1 data-start="569" data-end="580">Solución:</h1>
<h2 data-start="582" data-end="629">1. Revisa qué variables acepta la API Marine</h2>
<p data-start="631" data-end="785">En la <a data-start="637" data-end="736" class="cursor-pointer" rel="noopener" target="_new">documentación oficial de Open-Meteo Marine API</a> las variables marinas válidas para <code data-start="772" data-end="780">hourly</code> son:</p>
<ul data-start="787" data-end="899">
<li data-start="787" data-end="802">
<p data-start="789" data-end="802"><code data-start="789" data-end="802">wave_height</code></p>
</li>
<li data-start="803" data-end="821">
<p data-start="805" data-end="821"><code data-start="805" data-end="821">wave_direction</code></p>
</li>
<li data-start="822" data-end="837">
<p data-start="824" data-end="837"><code data-start="824" data-end="837">wave_period</code></p>
</li>
<li data-start="838" data-end="852">
<p data-start="840" data-end="852"><code data-start="840" data-end="852">wind_speed</code></p>
</li>
<li data-start="853" data-end="871">
<p data-start="855" data-end="871"><code data-start="855" data-end="871">wind_direction</code></p>
</li>
<li data-start="872" data-end="899">
<p data-start="874" data-end="899"><code data-start="874" data-end="899">sea_surface_temperature</code></p>
</li>
</ul>
<p data-start="901" data-end="1019">Pero es posible que no se puedan pedir todas juntas con una sola llamada o que el formato no sea una cadena con comas.</p>
<h2 data-start="1021" data-end="1063">2. Cambiar la forma de pasar parámetros</h2>
<p data-start="1065" data-end="1174">Revisando la documentación, <strong data-start="1093" data-end="1173">el parámetro <code data-start="1108" data-end="1116">hourly</code> debe ser un array o una lista, no una cadena con comas</strong>.</p>
<p data-start="1176" data-end="1239">Como estás usando <code data-start="1194" data-end="1208">requests.get</code>, debes pasar el parámetro así:</p>
<pre class="overflow-visible!" data-start="1241" data-end="1512"><div class="contain-inline-size rounded-2xl relative bg-token-sidebar-surface-primary"><div class="flex items-center
