language-python"><span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">def</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-title function_">get_tides_puertos</span></span><span>(</span><span><span class="hljs-params">port_id=<span class="hljs-string">"Las Palmas"</span></span></span><span>, start=inicio, end=fin):
    url = (</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"https://puertos.es/servicios/oceanografia/"</span></span><span>
           </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"Portus/DataService.asmx/GetTideModel"</span></span><span>)
    params = {</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"st"</span></span><span>: port_id, </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"ini"</span></span><span>: start, </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"end"</span></span><span>: end}
    resp = requests.get(url, params=params)
    data = resp.json().get(</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"TideModel"</span></span><span>, [])
    df = pd.DataFrame(data)
    df[</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"datetime"</span></span><span>] = pd.to_datetime(df[</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"datetime"</span></span><span>])
    </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">return</span></span><span> df

</span><span><span class="hljs-comment"># Dentro del bloque where wave/weather data is available:</span></span><span>
tides = get_tides_puertos()
</span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">if</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">not</span></span><span> tides.empty:
    st.subheader(</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"🌙 Nivel del mar (mareas) – Puertos del Estado"</span></span><span>)
    fig_tide = px.line(tides, x=</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"datetime"</span></span><span>, y=</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"tide"</span></span><span>, labels={</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"tide"</span></span><span>:</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"Nivel (m)"</span></span><span>})
    st.plotly_chart(fig_tide, use_container_width=</span><span><span class="hljs-literal">True</span></span><span>)
</span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">else</span></span><span>:
    st.info(</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"No se han podido obtener datos de mareas."</span></span><span>)
</span></span></code></div></div></pre>
<hr data-start="1042" data-end="1045">
<h2 data-start="1047" data-end="1103">2️⃣ Usar AEMET (requiere clave y configuración extra)</h2>
<p data-start="1104" data-end="1141"><span class="relative -mx-px my-[-0.2rem] rounded px-px py-[0.2rem] transition-colors duration-100 ease-in-out">Si prefieres AEMET y estás dispuesto a registrarte y manejar autenticación, se puede implementar usando su API OpenData. Pero es más complejo:</span></p>
<ul data-start="1143" data-end="1396">
<li data-start="1143" data-end="1221">
<p data-start="1145" data-end="1221"><span class="relative -mx-px my-[-0.2rem] rounded px-px py-[0.2rem] transition-colors duration-100 ease-in-out">Necesitas solicitar una <strong data-start="24" data-end="35">API key</strong> desde [AEMET OpenData]</span> <span class="" data-state="closed"><span class="ms-1 inline-flex max-w-full items-center relative top-[-0.094rem] animate-[show_150ms_ease-in]"><a href="https://www.puertos.es/servicios/oceanografia?utm_source=chatgpt.com" target="_blank" rel="noopener" alt="https://www.puertos.es/servicios/oceanografia?utm_source=chatgpt.com" class="flex h-4.5 overflow-hidden rounded-xl px-2 text-[9px] font-medium text-token-text-secondary! bg-[#F4F4F4]! dark:bg-[#303030]! transition-colors duration-150 ease-in-out"><span class="relative start-0 bottom-0 flex h-full w-full items-center"><span class="flex h-4 w-full items-center justify-between" style="opacity: 1; transform: none;"><span class="max-w-full grow truncate overflow-hidden text-center">puertos.es</span><span class="-me-1 flex h-full items-center rounded-full px-1 text-[#8F8F8F]">+1</span></span><span class="flex h-4 w-full items-center justify-between absolute" style="opacity: 0; transform: translateX(10%);"><span class="max-w-full grow truncate overflow-hidden text-center">odysseaplatform.eu</span><span class="-me-1 flex h-full items-center rounded-full px-1 text-[#8F8F8F]">+1</span></span></span></a></span></span><span class="" data-state="closed"><span class="ms-1 inline-flex max-w-full items-center relative top-[-0.094rem] animate-[show_150ms_ease-in]"><a href="https://cran.r-project.org/web/packages/meteospain/vignettes/aemet.html?utm_source=chatgpt.com" target="_blank" rel="noopener" alt="https://cran.r-project.org/web/packages/meteospain/vignettes/aemet.html?utm_source=chatgpt.com" class="flex h-4.5 overflow-hidden rounded-xl px-2 text-[9px] font-medium text-token-text-secondary! bg-[#F4F4F4]! dark:bg-[#303030]! transition-colors duration-150 ease-in-out"><span class="relative start-0 bottom-0 flex h-full w-full items-center"><span class="flex h-4 w-full items-center justify-between" style="opacity: 1; transform: none;"><span class="max-w-full grow truncate overflow-hidden text-center">cran.r-project.org</span><span class="-me-1 flex h-full items-center rounded-full px-1 text-[#8F8F8F]">+1</span></span><span class="flex h-4 w-full items-center justify-between absolute" style="opacity: 0; transform: translateX(10%);"><span class="max-w-full grow truncate overflow-hidden text-center">odysseaplatform.eu</span><span class="-me-1 flex h-full items-center rounded-full px-1 text-[#8F8F8F]">+1</span></span></span></a></span></span><span class="" data-state="closed"><span class="ms-1 inline-flex max-w-full items-center relative top-[-0.094rem] animate-[show_150ms_ease-in]"><a href="https://www.home-assistant.io/integrations/aemet/?utm_source=chatgpt.com" target="_blank" rel="noopener" alt="https://www.home-assistant.io/integrations/aemet/?utm_source=chatgpt.com" class="flex h-4.5 overflow-hidden rounded-xl px-2 text-[9px] font-medium text-token-text-secondary! bg-[#F4F4F4]! dark:bg-[#303030]! transition-colors duration-150 ease-in-out"><span class="relative start-0 bottom-0 flex h-full w-full items-center"><span class="flex h-4 w-full items-center justify-between absolute" style="opacity: 0; transform: none;"><span class="max-w-full grow truncate overflow-hidden text-center">datos.gob.es</span><span class="-me-1 flex h-full items-center rounded-full px-1 text-[#8F8F8F]">+4</span></span><span class="flex h-4 w-full items-center justify-between" style="opacity: 1; transform: none;"><span class="max-w-full grow truncate overflow-hidden text-center">home-assistant.io</span><span class="-me-1 flex h-full items-center rounded-full px-1 text-[#8F8F8F]">+4</span></span><span class="flex h-4 w-full items-center justify-between absolute" style="opacity: 0; transform: translateX(10%);"><span class="max-w-full grow truncate overflow-hidden text-center">opendata.aemet.es</span><span class="-me-1 flex h-full items-center rounded-full px-1 text-[#8F8F8F]">+4</span></span></span></a></span></span>.</p>
</li>
<li data-start="1222" data-end="1326">
<p data-start="1224" data-end="1326">Mandar peticiones autenticadas y procesar datos de estaciones, no necesariamente específicos de playa.</p>
</li>
<li data-start="1327" data-end="1396">
<p data-start="1329" data-end="1396">Requiere manejo adicional en código (registro clave, parsing JSON).</p>
</li>
</ul>
<hr data-start="1398" data-end="1401">
<h2 data-start="1403" data-end="1422">🔍 Recomendación</h2>
<p data-start="1424" data-end="1581">Para una integración rápida, práctica y sin claves, <strong data-start="1476" data-end="1502">usa Puertos del Estado</strong>. Si más adelante quieres un +proyecto y autenticación, podemos migrar a AEMET.</p>
<hr data-start="1583" data-end="1586">
<p data-start="1588" data-end="1706">¿Te interesa que te integre el código completo con Puertos del Estado en tu <code data-start="1664" data-end="1672">app.py</code> para tener mareas ya funcionando?</p>

@[37rem]:[--thread-content-margin:--spacing(6)] @[72rem]:[--thread-content-margin:--spacing(16)] px-(--thread-content-margin)"><div class="[--thread-content-max-width:32rem] @[34rem]:[--thread-content-max-width:40rem] @[64rem]:[--thread-content-max-width:48rem] mx-auto flex max-w-(--thread-content-max-width) flex-1 text-base gap-4 md:gap-5 lg:gap-6 group/turn-messages items-end gap-2 text-start break-words whitespace-normal [.text-message+&amp;]:mt-5" data-message-model-slug="gpt-4o"><div class="flex w-full flex-col gap-1 empty:hidden first:pt-[3px]"><div class="markdown prose dark:prose-invert w-full break-words light"><p data-start="0" data-end="106">Buena observación. En esta versión actual hay elementos que quitamos para simplificar temporalmente, como:</p>
<ul data-start="108" data-end="556">
<li data-start="108" data-end="180">
<p data-start="110" data-end="180">El <strong data-start="113" data-end="140">semaforo de condiciones</strong> (con las 5 olas en lugar del semáforo).</p>
</li>
<li data-start="181" data-end="248">
<p data-start="183" data-end="248">El <strong data-start="186" data-end="211">debug de datos crudos</strong> (<code data-start="213" data-end="246">st.write("Datos crudos API...")</code>).</p>
</li>
<li data-start="249" data-end="319">
<p data-start="251" data-end="319">La <strong data-start="254" data-end="293">visualización con puntuación visual</strong> para condiciones ideales.</p>
</li>
<li data-start="320" data-end="388">
<p data-start="322" data-end="388">La <strong data-start="325" data-end="352">comparación entre spots</strong>, que habías mencionado que querías.</p>
</li>
<li data-start="389" data-end="485">
<p data-start="391" data-end="485">Algunas métricas opcionales como temperatura del mar (aunque no venía en la API directamente).</p>
</li>
<li data-start="486" data-end="556">
<p data-start="488" data-end="556">Iconos visuales adicionales (por ejemplo, olas, tablas, puntuación).</p>
</li>
</ul>
<p data-start="558" data-end="735">Esto lo hicimos para centrarnos en integrar correctamente las <strong data-start="620" data-end="630">mareas</strong>, pero no hay ningún problema en <strong data-start="663" data-end="691">recuperar lo que quieras</strong> o <strong data-start="694" data-end="713">reintegrar todo</strong> junto con las mareas.</p>
<p data-start="737" data-end="780">¿Quieres que vuelva a incluir, por ejemplo?</p>
<ol data-start="782" data-end="1043">
<li data-start="782" data-end="831">
<p data-start="785" data-end="831">✅ Las <strong data-start="791" data-end="822">olas como puntuación visual</strong> (1 a 5).</p>
</li>
<li data-start="832" data-end="895">
<p data-start="835" data-end="895">✅ Comparativa de spots (ordenarlos por condiciones ideales).</p>
</li>
<li data-start="896" data-end="982">
<p data-start="899" data-end="982">✅ Métricas visuales adicionales (por ejemplo, swell period o dirección del viento).</p>
</li>
<li data-start="983" data-end="1043">
<p data-start="986" data-end="1043">✅ Mostrar datos crudos solo si se activa un modo "debug".</p>
</li>
</ol>
<p data-start="1045" data-end="1141" data-is-last-node="" data-is-only-node="">Solo dime qué elementos quieres que mantengamos o reactivemos y lo dejo todo combinado y </span></span></code></div></div></pre>
<p data-start="242" data-end="400">Esto muestra entre 1 y 5 olas (🌊) según la puntuación. Si esperabas que esa visualización también se aplicara en la <strong data-start="359" data-end="383">comparativa de spots</strong>, aún no lo hace.</p>
<p data-start="402" data-end="415">¿Quieres que:</p>
<ol data-start="417" data-end="664">
<li data-start="417" data-end="563">
<p data-start="420" data-end="563"><strong data-start="420" data-end="500">Añadamos las olas como iconos también en la tabla de comparativa entre spots</strong>, sustituyendo o acompañando la columna de puntuación numérica?</p>
</li>
<li data-start="564" data-end="664">
<p data-start="567" data-end="664">O bien que se muestre de otro modo (por ejemplo, gráfico de barras con iconos o algo más visual)?</p>
</li>
</ol>
<p data-start="666" data-end="714" data-is-last-node="" data-is-only-node="">Dime qué prefieres y te lo implemento enseguida.</p></div></div></div></div><div class="flex min-h-[46px] justify-start"><div class="touch:-me-2 touch:-ms-3.5 -ms-2.5 -me-1 flex flex-wrap items-center gap-y-4 p-1 select-none touch:w-[calc(100%+--spacing(3.5))] -mt-1 w-[calc(100%+--spacing(2.5))] dir="auto" data-testid="conversation-turn-70" data-scroll-anchor="false" style=""><h6 class="sr-only">ChatGPT Plus</h6><div class="text-base my-auto mx-auto py-5 [--thread-content-margin:--spacing(4)] @[37rem]:[--thread-content-margin:--spacing(6)] @[72rem]:[--thread-content-margin:--spacing(16)] px-(--thread-content-margin)"><div class="[--thread-content-max-width:32rem] @[34rem]:[--thread-content-max-width:40rem] @[64rem]:[--thread-content-max-width:48rem] mx-auto flex max-w-(--thread-content-max-width) flex-1 text-base gap-4 md:gap-5 lg:gap-6 group/turn-messages focus-visible:outline-hidden" tabindex="-1"><div class="group/conversation-turn relative flex w-full min-w-0 flex-col agent-turn"><div class="relative flex-col gap-1 md:gap-3"><div class="flex max-w-full flex-col grow"><div data-message-author-role="assistant" data-message-id="3349daf1-1d6f-4b82-a055-affa3b02d7bf" dir="auto" class="min-h-8 text-message relative flex w-full flex-col items-end gap-2 text-start break-words whitespace-normal [.text-message+&amp;]:mt-5" data-message-model-slug="gpt-4o"><div class="flex w-full flex-col gap-1 empty:hidden first:pt-[3px]"><div class="markdown prose dark:prose-invert w-full break-words light"><p data-start="0" data-end="209">¡Genial que ya tenga forma! Ahora que tu dashboard está completo y funcional, aquí te dejo algunas sugerencias <strong data-start="111" data-end="125">opcionales</strong> para seguir mejorándolo o dejarlo listo para compartir como proyecto de portafolio:</p>
<hr data-start="211" data-end="214">
<h3 data-start="216" data-end="247">🌟 Ideas de mejoras finales</h3>
<h4 data-start="249" data-end="290">1. <strong data-start="257" data-end="290">Mostrar puntuaciones horarias</strong></h4>
<ul data-start="291" data-end="415">
<li data-start="291" data-end="415">
<p data-start="293" data-end="415">En vez de solo mostrar la puntuación máxima de cada spot, podrías mostrar una <strong data-start="371" data-end="414">gráfica del score a lo largo del tiempo</strong>.</p>
</li>
</ul>
<h4 data-start="417" data-end="469">2. <strong data-start="425" data-end="469">Indicador visual de "buenas condiciones"</strong></h4>
<ul data-start="470" data-end="595">
<li data-start="470" data-end="595">
<p data-start="472" data-end="553">Por ejemplo, si la puntuación actual es 4 o 5, mostrar un mensaje destacado tipo:</p>
<blockquote data-start="556" data-end="595">
<p data-start="558" data-end="595">🟢 ¡Condiciones óptimas para surfear!</p>
</blockquote>
</li>
</ul>
<h4 data-start="597" data-end="635">3. <strong data-start="605" data-end="635">Filtrar por franja horaria</strong></h4>
<ul data-start="636" data-end="720">
<li data-start="636" data-end="720">
<p data-start="638" data-end="720">Permitir al usuario elegir si quiere ver datos de <strong data-start="688" data-end="719">mañana, tarde o todo el día</strong>.</p>
</li>
</ul>
<h4 data-start="722" data-end="772">4. <strong data-start="730" data-end="772">Guardar favoritos o historial de spots</strong></h4>
<ul data-start="773" data-end="848">
<li data-start="773" data-end="848">
<p data-start="775" data-end="848">Agregar una opción para marcar un spot como favorito y mostrarlo primero.</p>
</li>
</ul>
<h4 data-start="850" data-end="901">5. <strong data-start="858" data-end="901">Integración con webcams o fotos en vivo</strong></h4>
<ul data-start="902" data-end="1005">
<li data-start="902" data-end="1005">
<p data-start="904" data-end="1005">Usar si están disponibles públicamente para cada spot (como las de Surfline, si hay API o embedding).</p>
</li>
</ul>
<hr data-start="1007" data-end="1010">
<h3 data-start="1012" data-end="1043">🚀 Ideas para el portafolio</h3>
<ul data-start="1045" data-end="1457">
<li data-start="1045" data-end="1228">
<p data-start="1047" data-end="1105">Añadir una sección en la app con un <code data-start="1083" data-end="1095">st.sidebar</code> que diga:</p>
<blockquote data-start="1108" data-end="1228">
<p data-start="1110" data-end="1228">📘 <em data-start="1113" data-end="1228">Este proyecto ha sido desarrollado por Yone como parte del portafolio del Grado en Ciencia e Ingeniería de Datos.</em></p>
</blockquote>
</li>
<li data-start="1230" data-end="1317">
<p data-start="1232" data-end="1317">Exportarlo como app a <strong data-start="1254" data-end="1273">Streamlit Cloud</strong> o <strong data-start="1276" data-end="1298">HuggingFace Spaces</strong> (ambas gratuitas).</p>
</li>
<li data-start="1319" data-end="1457">
<p data-start="1321" data-end="1344">Publicar en GitHub con:</p>
<ul data-start="1347" data-end="1457">
<li data-start="1347" data-end="1388">
<p data-start="1349" data-end="1388"><code data-start="1349" data-end="1360">README.md</code> con capturas y descripción.</p>
</li>
<li data-start="1391" data-end="1425">
<p data-start="1393" data-end="1425">Requisitos (<code data-start="1405" data-end="1423">requirements.txt</code>).</p>
</li>
<li data-start="1428" data-end="1457">
<p data-start="1430" data-end="1457">Licencia abierta, como MIT.</p>
</li>
</ul>
</li>
</ul>
<hr data-start="1459" data-end="1462">
<p data-start="1464" data-end="1597" data-is-last-node="" data-is-only-node="">¿Quieres que te ayude a empaquetarlo como proyecto de portafolio? También te puedo preparar el README o ayudarte a publicarlo online.</p></div></div></div></div><div class="flex min-h-[46px] justify-start"><div class="touch:-me-2 touch:-ms-3.5 -ms-2.5 -me-1 flex         st.error(</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"🌧️ **Condiciones desfavorables para el surf.**"</span></span><span>)

<h3 data-start="645" data-end="659">Resultado:</h3>
<ul data-start="660" data-end="778">
<li data-start="660" data-end="697">
<p data-start="662" data-end="697"><code data-start="662" data-end="669">score</code> 4-5: ✅ mensaje verde con ☀️</p>
</li>
<li data-start="698" data-end="740">
<p data-start="700" data-end="740"><code data-start="700" data-end="707">score</code> 2-3: ⚠️ mensaje amarillo con 🌤️</p>
</li>
<li data-start="741" data-end="778">
<p data-start="743" data-end="778"><code data-start="743" data-end="750">score</code> 0-1: ❌ mensaje rojo con 🌧️</p>
</li>
</ul>

dir="auto" data-testid="conversation-turn-74" data-scroll-anchor="false" style=""><h6 class="sr-only">ChatGPT Plus</h6><div class="text-base my-auto mx-auto py-5 [--thread-content-margin:--spacing(4)] @[37rem]:[--thread-content-margin:--spacing(6)] @[72rem]:[--thread-content-margin:--spacing(16)] px-(--thread-content-margin)"><div class="[--thread-content-max-width:32rem] @[34rem]:[--thread-content-max-width:40rem] @[64rem]:[--thread-content-max-width:48rem] mx-auto flex max-w-(--thread-content-max-width) flex-1 text-base gap-4 md:gap-5 lg:gap-6 group/turn-messages focus-visible:outline-hidden" tabindex="-1"><div class="group/conversation-turn relative flex w-full min-w-0 flex-col agent-turn"><div class="relative flex-col gap-1 md:gap-3"><div class="flex max-w-full flex-col grow"><div data-message-author-role="assistant" data-message-id="4ed85780-0160-4c8b-b6fa-97e8ce4cdd7b" dir="auto" class="min-h-8 text-message relative flex w-full flex-col items-end gap-2 text-start break-words whitespace-normal [.text-message+&amp;]:mt-5" data-message-model-slug="gpt-4-1-mini"><div class="flex w-full flex-col gap-1 empty:hidden first:pt-[3px]"><div class="markdown prose dark:prose-invert w-full break-words light"><p data-start="0" data-end="132">Perfecto, para añadir colores diferentes en los marcadores del mapa según la puntuación del spot actual, podemos hacer lo siguiente:</p>
<ol data-start="134" data-end="459">
<li data-start="134" data-end="200">
<p data-start="137" data-end="200">Calcular la puntuación para cada spot (último dato disponible).</p>
</li>
<li data-start="201" data-end="364">
<p data-start="204" data-end="240">Asignar un color RGB según el score:</p>
<ul data-start="244" data-end="364">
<li data-start="244" data-end="281">
<p data-start="246" data-end="281">Verde para buenas condiciones (4-5)</p>
</li>
<li data-start="285" data-end="325">
<p data-start="287" data-end="325">Amarillo para condiciones medias (2-3)</p>
</li>
<li data-start="329" data-end="364">
<p data-start="331" data-end="364">Rojo para malas condiciones (0-1)</p>
</li>
</ul>
</li>
<li data-start="365" data-end="459">
<p data-start="368" data-end="459">Pasar esos colores al DataFrame de spots y usarlos en la capa <code data-start="430" data-end="448">ScatterplotLayer</code> de pydeck.</p>
</li>
</ol>
<hr data-start="461" data-end="464">
<p data-start="466" data-end="643">Aquí tienes el código modificado para integrar esto justo antes de mostrar el mapa, asumiendo que ya tienes la función <code data-start="585" data-end="606">evaluar_condiciones</code> y las funciones para obtener datos:</p>
<pre class="overflow-visible!" data-start="645" data-end="1829"><div class="contain-inline-size rounded-2xl relative bg-token-sidebar-surface-primary"><div class="flex items-center 17.0869 5.94456 16.1963 5.05371Z"></path><path d="M4.58301 1.7832C4.72589 1.7832 4.84877 1.88437 4.87695 2.02441C4.99384 2.60873 5.22432 3.11642 5.58398 3.50391C5.94115 3.88854 6.44253 4.172 7.13281 2.0332 4.87891C1.88897 4.85446 1.7832 4.72938 1.7832 4.58301C1.78335 4.43673 1.88902 4.3115 2.0332 4.28711C2.72366 4.17203 3.22481 3.88861 3.58203 3.50391C3.94186 3.11638 4.17214 2.60888 4.28906 2.02441L4.30371 1.97363C4.34801 1.86052 4.45804 1.78333 4.58301 1.7832Z"></path></svg>Editar</button></span></div></div></div><div class="overflow-y-auto p-4" dir="ltr"><code class="whitespace-pre! language-python"><span><span><span class="hljs-comment"># Antes de crear df_spots, obtenemos la puntuación para cada spot y el color</span></span><span>

</span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">def</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-title function_">score_to_color</span></span><span>(</span><span><span class="hljs-params">score</span></span><span>):
    </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">if</span></span><span> score &gt;= </span><span><span class="hljs-number">4</span></span><span>:
        </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">return</span></span><span> [</span><span><span class="hljs-number">0</span></span><span>, </span><span><span class="hljs-number">255</span></span><span>, </span><span><span class="hljs-number">0</span></span><span>, </span><span><span class="hljs-number">160</span></span><span>]   </span><span><span class="hljs-comment"># Verde</span></span><span>
    </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">elif</span></span><span> score &gt;= </span><span><span class="hljs-number">2</span></span><span>:
        </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">return</span></span><span> [</span><span><span class="hljs-number">255</span></span><span>, </span><span><span class="hljs-number">255</span></span><span>, </span><span><span class="hljs-number">0</span></span><span>, </span><span><span class="hljs-number">160</span></span><span>] </span><span><span class="hljs-comment"># Amarillo</span></span><span>
    </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">else</span></span><span>:
        </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">return</span></span><span> [</span><span><span class="hljs-number">255</span></span><span>, </span><span><span class="hljs-number">0</span></span><span>, </span><span><span class="hljs-number">0</span></span><span>, </span><span><span class="hljs-number">160</span></span><span>]   </span><span><span class="hljs-comment"># Rojo</span></span><span>

comparativa_colores = []
</span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">for</span></span><span> spot, (lat, lon) </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">in</span></span><span> SPOTS.items():
    wave = get_wave_data(lat, lon, inicio, fin)
    weather = get_weather_data(lat, lon, inicio, fin)
    </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">if</span></span><span> wave.empty </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">or</span></span><span> weather.empty:
        color = [</span><span><span class="hljs-number">128</span></span><span>,</span><span><span class="hljs-number">128</span></span><span>,</span><span><span class="hljs-number">128</span></span><span>,</span><span><span class="hljs-number">160</span></span><span>]  </span><span><span class="hljs-comment"># Gris si no hay datos</span></span><span>
    </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">else</span></span><span>:
        comb = pd.merge(wave, weather, on=</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"time"</span></span><span>, how=</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"inner"</span></span><span>)
        comb[</span><span><span class="hljs-string">'score'</span></span><span>] = comb.apply(evaluar_condiciones, axis=</span><span><span class="hljs-number">1</span></span><span>)
        score = comb[</span><span><span class="hljs-string">'score'</span></span><span>].iloc[-</span><span><span class="hljs-number">1</span></span><span>]
        color = score_to_color(score)
    comparativa_colores.append({</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"Spot"</span></span><span>: spot, </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"lat"</span></span><span>: lat, </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"lon"</span></span><span>: lon, </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"color"</span></span><span>: color})

df_spots = pd.DataFrame(comparativa_colores)

</span><span><span class="hljs-comment"># Y luego, en la capa pydeck, en lugar de get_color fijo:</span></span><span>
layers=[
    pdk.Layer(
        </span><span><span class="hljs-string">'ScatterplotLayer'</span></span><span>,
        data=df_spots,
        get_position=</span><span><span class="hljs-string">'[lon, lat]'</span></span><span>,
        get_color=</span><span><span class="hljs-string">'color'</span></span><span>,
        get_radius=</span><span><span class="hljs-number">300</span></span><span>,
        pickable=</span><span><span class="hljs-literal">True</span></span><span>,
        auto_highlight=</span><span><span class="hljs-literal">True</span></span><span>,
    )
]
</span></span></code></div></div></pre>
<p data-start="1831" data-end="1984">Esto hará que cada punto del mapa cambie de color según las condiciones actuales de surf. Si quieres te lo preparo completo dentro del código que tienes.</p>
<hr data-start="1986" data-end="1989">

3.56348 6.34668L3.70606 6.28027C4.04237 6.136 4.40303 6.07083 4.80371 6.03809C5.14051 6.01057 5.53708 6.00551 6.00391 6.00391C6.00551 5.53708 6.01057 5.14051 6.03809 4.80371C6.0755 4.34588 6.15483 1.83496H13.5C14.1891 1.83496 14.746 1.83431 15.1963 1.87109C15.6541 1.90851 16.0599 1.98788 16.4365 2.17969L16.6553 2.30176C17.151 2.60585 17.5548 3.04244 17.8203 3.56348L17.8867 3.70606C18.031 4.04235 18.0962 4.40306 18.1289 4.80371C18.1657 5.25395 18.165 5.81091 18.165 6.5V9.33301Z"></path></svg>Copiar</button><span class="" data-state="closed"><button class="flex items-center gap-1 py-1 select-none"><svg width="20" height="20" viewBox="0 0 20 20" fill="currentColor" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" class="icon-xs"><path d="M12.0303 4.11328C13.4406 2.70317 15.7275 2.70305 17.1377 4.11328C18.5474 5.52355 18.5476 7.81057 17.1377 9.2207L10.8457 15.5117C10.522 15.8354 10.2868 16.0723 10.0547 16.2627L9.82031 16.4395C9.61539 16.5794 9.39783 16.7003 9.1709 16.7998L8.94141 16.8916C8.75976 16.9582 8.57206 17.0072 8.35547 17.0518L7.59082 17.1865L5.19727 17.5859C5.05455 17.6097 4.90286 17.6358 4.77441 17.6455C4.67576 17.653 4.54196 17.6555 4.39648 17.6201L4.24707 17.5703C4.02415 17.4746 3.84119 17.3068 3.72559 17.0957L3.67969 17.0029C3.59322 16.8013 3.59553 16.6073 3.60547 16.4756C3.61519 16.3473 3.6403 16.1963 3.66406 16.0537L4.06348 13.6602C4.1638 13.0582 4.22517 12.6732 4.3584 12.3096L4.45117 12.0791C4.55073 11.8521 4.67152 11.6346 4.81152 11.4297L4.9873 11.1953C5.17772 10.9632 5.4146 10.728 5.73828 10.4043L12.0303 4.11328ZM6.67871 11.3447C6.32926 11.6942 6.14542 11.8803 6.01953 12.0332L5.90918 12.1797C5.81574 12.3165 5.73539 12.4618 5.66895 12.6133L5.60742 12.7666C5.52668 12.9869 5.48332 13.229 5.375 13.8789L4.97656 16.2725L4.97559 16.2744H4.97852L7.37207 15.875L8.08887 15.749C8.25765 15.7147 8.37336 15.6839 8.4834 15.6436L8.63672 15.5811C8.78817 15.5146 8.93356 15.4342 9.07031 15.3408L9.2168 15.2305C9.36965 15.1046 9.55583 14.9207 9.90527 14.5713L14.8926 9.58301L11.666 6.35742L6.67871 11.3447ZM16.1963 5.05371C15.3054 4.16304 13.8616 4.16305 12.9707 5.05371L12.6074 5.41602L15.833 8.64258L16.1963 8.2793C17.0869 7.38845 17.0869 5.94456 16.1963 5.05371Z"></path><path d="M4.58301 1.7832C4.72589 1.7832 4.84877 1.88437 4.87695 2.02441C4.99384 2.60873 5.22432 3.11642 5.58398 3.50391C5.94115 3.88854 6.44253 4.172 7.13281 4.28711C7.27713 4.3114 7.38267 4.43665 7.38281 4.58301C7.38281 4.7295 7.27723 4.8546 7.13281 4.87891C6.44249 4.99401 5.94116 5.27746 5.58398 5.66211C5.26908 6.00126 5.05404 6.43267 4.92676 6.92676L4.87695 7.1416C4.84891 7.28183 4.72601 7.38281 4.58301 7.38281C4.44013 7.38267 4.31709 7.28173 4.28906 7.1416C4.17212 6.55728 3.94179 6.04956 3.58203 5.66211C3.22483 5.27757 2.72347 4.99395 2.0332 4.87891C1.88897 4.85446 1.7832 4.72938 1.7832 4.58301C1.78335 4.43673 1.88902 4.3115 2.0332 4.28711C2.72366 4.17203 3.22481 3.88861 3.58203 3.50391C3.94186 3.11638 4.17214 2.60888 4.28906 2.02441L4.30371 1.97363C4.34801 1.86052 4.45804 1.78333 4.58301 1.7832Z"></path></svg>Editar</button></span></div></div></div><div class="overflow-y-auto p-4" dir="ltr"><code class="whitespace-pre! language-python"><span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">import</span></span><span> streamlit </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">as</span></span><span> st
</span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">import</span></span><span> requests
</span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">import</span></span><span> pandas </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">as</span></span><span> pd
</span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">import</span></span><span> plotly.express </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">as</span></span><span> px
</span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">from</span></span><span> datetime </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">import</span></span><span> datetime, timedelta, timezone
</span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">import</span></span><span> pydeck </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">as</span></span><span> pdk

</span><span><span class="hljs-comment"># Coordenadas de los spots de surf</span></span><span>
SPOTS = {
    </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"La Cícer"</span></span><span>: (</span><span><span class="hljs-number">28.13110735259434</span></span><span>, -</span><span><span class="hljs-number">15.446698859594266</span></span><span>),
    </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"El Confital"</span></span><span>: (</span><span><span class="hljs-number">28.1441</span></span><span>, -</span><span><span class="hljs-number">15.4340</span></span><span>),
    </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"La Laja"</span></span><span>: (</span><span><span class="hljs-number">28.0747</span></span><span>, -</span><span><span class="hljs-number">15.4123</span></span><span>),
    </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"San Andrés"</span></span><span>: (</span><span><span class="hljs-number">28.14670670936141</span></span><span>, -</span><span><span class="hljs-number">15.555085904921604</span></span><span>),
}

</span><span><span class="hljs-comment"># Función para evaluar condiciones de surf y asignar una puntuación de 1 a 5</span></span><span>
</span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">def</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-title function_">evaluar_condiciones</span></span><span>(</span><span><span class="hljs-params">row</span></span><span>):
    score = </span><span><span class="hljs-number">0</span></span><span>
    </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">if</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-number">0.8</span></span><span> &lt;= row[</span><span><span class="hljs-string">'wave_height'</span></span><span>] &lt;= </span><span><span class="hljs-number">2.0</span></span><span>:
        score += </span><span><span class="hljs-number">2</span></span><span>
    </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">elif</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-number">0.5</span></span><span> &lt;= row[</span><span><span class="hljs-string">'wave_height'</span></span><span>] &lt; </span><span><span class="hljs-number">0.8</span></span><span>:
        score += </span><span><span class="hljs-number">1</span></span><span>
    </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">if</span></span><span> row[</span><span><span class="hljs-string">'swell_wave_period'</span></span><span>] &gt;= </span><span><span class="hljs-number">10</span></span><span>:
        score += </span><span><span class="hljs-number">2</span></span><span>
    </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">elif</span></span><span> row[</span><span><span class="hljs-string">'swell_wave_period'</span></span><span>] &gt;= </span><span><span class="hljs-number">7</span></span><span>:
        score += </span><span><span class="hljs-number">1</span></span><span>
    </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">if</span></span><span> row[</span><span><span class="hljs-string">'windspeed_10m'</span></span><span>] &lt; </span><span><span class="hljs-number">15</span></span><span>:
        score += </span><span><span class="hljs-number">1</span></span><span>
    </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">return</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-built_in">min</span></span><span>(score, </span><span><span class="hljs-number">5</span></span><span>)

</span><span><span class="hljs-comment"># Funciones para obtener datos</span></span><span>
</span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">def</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-title function_">get_wave_data</span></span><span>(</span><span><span class="hljs-params">lat, lon, start_date, end_date</span></span><span>):
    url = </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"https://marine-api.open-meteo.com/v1/marine"</span></span><span>
    params = {
        </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"latitude"</span></span><span>: lat,
        </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"longitude"</span></span><span>: lon,
        </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"hourly"</span></span><span>: </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"wave_height,wind_wave_height,swell_wave_height,wind_wave_direction,swell_wave_period"</span></span><span>,
        </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"start_date"</span></span><span>: start_date,
        </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"end_date"</span></span><span>: end_date,
        </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"timezone"</span></span><span>: </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"auto"</span></span><span>
    }
    response = requests.get(url, params=params)
    data = response.json()
    </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">if</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"hourly"</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">not</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">in</span></span><span> data:
        </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">return</span></span><span> pd.DataFrame()
    df = pd.DataFrame(data[</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"hourly"</span></span><span>])
    </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">if</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">not</span></span><span> df.empty:
        df[</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"time"</span></span><span>] = pd.to_datetime(df[</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"time"</span></span><span>])
    </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">return</span></span><span> df

</span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">def</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-title function_">get_weather_data</span></span><span>(</span><span><span class="hljs-params">lat, lon, start_date, end_date</span></span><span>):
    url = </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"https://api.open-meteo.com/v1/forecast"</span></span><span>
    params = {
        </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"latitude"</span></span><span>: lat,
        </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"longitude"</span></span><span>: lon,
        </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"hourly"</span></span><span>: </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"windspeed_10m"</span></span><span>,
        </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"start"</span></span><span>: start_date,
        </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"end"</span></span><span>: end_date,
        </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"timezone"</span></span><span>: </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"auto"</span></span><span>
    }
    response = requests.get(url, params=params)
    data = response.json()
    </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">if</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"hourly"</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">not</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">in</span></span><span> data:
        </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">return</span></span><span> pd.DataFrame()
    df = pd.DataFrame(data[</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"hourly"</span></span><span>])
    </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">if</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">not</span></span><span> df.empty:
        df[</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"time"</span></span><span>] = pd.to_datetime(df[</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"time"</span></span><span>])
    </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">return</span></span><span> df

</span><span><span class="hljs-comment"># Map color by score</span></span><span>
</span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">def</span></span><span> </span><span><span class="hljs-title function_">score_to_color</span></span><span>(</span><span><span class="hljs-params">score</span></span><span>):
    </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">if</span></span><span> score &gt;= </span><span><span class="hljs-number">4</span></span><span>:
        </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">return</span></span><span> [</span><span><span class="hljs-number">0</span></span><span>, </span><span><span class="hljs-number">255</span></span><span>, </span><span><span class="hljs-number">0</span></span><span>, </span><span><span class="hljs-number">160</span></span><span>]   </span><span><span class="hljs-comment"># Verde</span></span><span>
    </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">elif</span></span><span> score &gt;= </span><span><span class="hljs-number">2</span></span><span>:
        </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">return</span></span><span> [</span><span><span class="hljs-number">255</span></span><span>, </span><span><span class="hljs-number">255</span></span><span>, </span><span><span class="hljs-number">0</span></span><span>, </span><span><span class="hljs-number">160</span></span><span>] </span><span><span class="hljs-comment"># Amarillo</span></span><span>
    </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">else</span></span><span>:
        </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">return</span></span><span> [</span><span><span class="hljs-number">255</span></span><span>, </span><span><span class="hljs-number">0</span></span><span>, </span><span><span class="hljs-number">0</span></span><span>, </span><span><span class="hljs-number">160</span></span><span>]   </span><span><span class="hljs-comment"># Rojo</span></span><span>

</span><span><span class="hljs-comment"># Fechas</span></span><span>
hoy = datetime.now(timezone.utc).date()
inicio = hoy.strftime(</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"%Y-%m-%d"</span></span><span>)
fin = (hoy + timedelta(days=</span><span><span class="hljs-number">1</span></span><span>)).strftime(</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"%Y-%m-%d"</span></span><span>)

</span><span><span class="hljs-comment"># Calcular colores para cada spot según su score actual</span></span><span>
comparativa_colores = []
</span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">for</span></span><span> spot, (lat, lon) </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">in</span></span><span> SPOTS.items():
    wave = get_wave_data(lat, lon, inicio, fin)
    weather = get_weather_data(lat, lon, inicio, fin)
    </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">if</span></span><span> wave.empty </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">or</span></span><span> weather.empty:
        color = [</span><span><span class="hljs-number">128</span></span><span>, </span><span><span class="hljs-number">128</span></span><span>, </span><span><span class="hljs-number">128</span></span><span>, </span><span><span class="hljs-number">160</span></span><span>]  </span><span><span class="hljs-comment"># Gris si no hay datos</span></span><span>
    </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">else</span></span><span>:
        comb = pd.merge(wave, weather, on=</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"time"</span></span><span>, how=</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"inner"</span></span><span>)
        comb[</span><span><span class="hljs-string">'score'</span></span><span>] = comb.apply(evaluar_condiciones, axis=</span><span><span class="hljs-number">1</span></span><span>)
        score = comb[</span><span><span class="hljs-string">'score'</span></span><span>].iloc[-</span><span><span class="hljs-number">1</span></span><span>]
        color = score_to_color(score)
    comparativa_colores.append({</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"Spot"</span></span><span>: spot, </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"lat"</span></span><span>: lat, </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"lon"</span></span><span>: lon, </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"color"</span></span><span>: color})

df_spots = pd.DataFrame(comparativa_colores)
midpoint = (df_spots[</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"lat"</span></span><span>].mean(), df_spots[</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"lon"</span></span><span>].mean())

</span><span><span class="hljs-comment"># Streamlit UI</span></span><span>
st.set_page_config(page_title=</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"Surf Dashboard - Canarias"</span></span><span>, layout=</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"wide"</span></span><span>)
st.title(</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"🏄 Surf Dashboard - Spots de Gran Canaria"</span></span><span>)

st.subheader(</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"📍 Mapa de Spots de Surf en Gran Canaria"</span></span><span>)

st.pydeck_chart(pdk.Deck(
    map_style=</span><span><span class="hljs-string">'https://basemaps.cartocdn.com/gl/dark-matter-gl-style/style.json'</span></span><span>,
    initial_view_state=pdk.ViewState(
        latitude=midpoint[</span><span><span class="hljs-number">0</span></span><span>],
        longitude=midpoint[</span><span><span class="hljs-number">1</span></span><span>],
        zoom=</span><span><span class="hljs-number">11</span></span><span>,
        pitch=</span><span><span class="hljs-number">0</span></span><span>,
    ),
    layers=[
        pdk.Layer(
            </span><span><span class="hljs-string">'ScatterplotLayer'</span></span><span>,
            data=df_spots,
            get_position=</span><span><span class="hljs-string">'[lon, lat]'</span></span><span>,
            get_color=</span><span><span class="hljs-string">'color'</span></span><span>,
            get_radius=</span><span><span class="hljs-number">300</span></span><span>,
            pickable=</span><span><span class="hljs-literal">True</span></span><span>,
            auto_highlight=</span><span><span class="hljs-literal">True</span></span><span>,
        )
    ],
    tooltip={</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"text"</span></span><span>: </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"{Spot}"</span></span><span>}
))

</span><span><span class="hljs-comment"># Selección de spot</span></span><span>
spot_name = st.selectbox(</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"Selecciona un spot de surf:"</span></span><span>, </span><span><span class="hljs-built_in">list</span></span><span>(SPOTS.keys()))
lat, lon = SPOTS[spot_name]

</span><span><span class="hljs-comment"># Datos para spot seleccionado</span></span><span>
wave_data = get_wave_data(lat, lon, inicio, fin)
weather_data = get_weather_data(lat, lon, inicio, fin)

</span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">if</span></span><span> wave_data.empty </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">or</span></span><span> weather_data.empty:
    st.warning(</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"No se han encontrado datos suficientes para las fechas seleccionadas y el spot."</span></span><span>)
</span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">else</span></span><span>:
    combined = pd.merge(wave_data, weather_data, on=</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"time"</span></span><span>, how=</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"inner"</span></span><span>)
    combined[</span><span><span class="hljs-string">'score'</span></span><span>] = combined.apply(evaluar_condiciones, axis=</span><span><span class="hljs-number">1</span></span><span>)
    actual = combined.iloc[-</span><span><span class="hljs-number">1</span></span><span>]

    col1, col2, col3 = st.columns(</span><span><span class="hljs-number">3</span></span><span>)
    col1.metric(</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"Altura de ola"</span></span><span>, </span><span><span class="hljs-string">f"<span class="hljs-subst">{actual[<span class="hljs-string">'wave_height'</span></span></span></span><span>]:</span><span><span class="hljs-number">.2</span></span><span>f} m")
    col2.metric(</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"Viento (10m)"</span></span><span>, </span><span><span class="hljs-string">f"<span class="hljs-subst">{actual[<span class="hljs-string">'windspeed_10m'</span></span></span></span><span>]:</span><span><span class="hljs-number">.1</span></span><span>f} km/h")
    col3.metric(</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"Altura ola swell"</span></span><span>, </span><span><span class="hljs-string">f"<span class="hljs-subst">{actual[<span class="hljs-string">'swell_wave_height'</span></span></span></span><span>]:</span><span><span class="hljs-number">.2</span></span><span>f} m")

    </span><span><span class="hljs-comment"># Mostrar puntuación con olas</span></span><span>
    st.markdown(</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"### ⭐ Condiciones actuales de surf"</span></span><span>)
    ola_url = </span><span><span class="hljs-string">"https://cdn-icons-png.flaticon.com/512/861/861060.png"</span></span><span>
    st.image([ola_url]*actual[</span><span><span class="hljs-string">'score'</span></span><span>], width=</span><span><span class="hljs-number">40</span></span><span>)

    </span><span><span class="hljs-comment"># Indicador visual de condiciones</span></span><span>
    </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">if</span></span><span> actual[</span><span><span class="hljs-string">'score'</span></span><span>] &gt;= </span><span><span class="hljs-number">4</span></span><span>:
        st.success(</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"🌞 ¡Muy buenas condiciones para surfear!"</span></span><span>)
    </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">elif</span></span><span> actual[</span><span><span class="hljs-string">'score'</span></span><span>] &gt;= </span><span><span class="hljs-number">2</span></span><span>:
        st.warning(</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"🌤️ Condiciones regulares. Consulta el detalle."</span></span><span>)
    </span><span><span class="hljs-keyword">else</span></span><span>:
        st.error(</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"🌧️ Condiciones desfavorables para el surf."</span></span><span>)

    st.subheader(</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"📈 Evolución de las condiciones marinas y meteorológicas (48h)"</span></span><span>)
    fig1 = px.line(combined, x=</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"time"</span></span><span>, y=</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"wave_height"</span></span><span>, title=</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"Altura de las olas (m)"</span></span><span>)
    fig2 = px.line(combined, x=</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"time"</span></span><span>, y=</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"swell_wave_period"</span></span><span>, title=</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"Periodo de las olas swell (s)"</span></span><span>)
    fig3 = px.line(combined, x=</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"time"</span></span><span>, y=</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"windspeed_10m"</span></span><span>, title=</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"Velocidad del viento a 10m (km/h)"</span></span><span>)

    st.plotly_chart(fig1, use_container_width=</span><span><span class="hljs-literal">True</span></span><span>)
    st.plotly_chart(fig2, use_container_width=</span><span><span class="hljs-literal">True</span></span><span>)
    st.plotly_chart(fig3, use_container_width=</span><span><span class="hljs-literal">True</span></span><span>)

st.caption(</span><span><span class="hljs-string">"Datos obtenidos desde Open-Meteo"</span></span><span>)
</span></span></code></div></div></pre>
<hr data-start="6087" data-end="6090">
<p data-start="6092" data-end="6100"><strong data-start="6092" data-end="6100">Así:</strong></p>
<ul data-start="6101" data-end="6350">
<li data-start="6101" data-end="6174">
<p data-start="6103" data-end="6174">El mapa muestra puntos en verde, amarillo o rojo según las condiciones.</p>
</li>
<li data-start="6175" data-end="6254">
<p data-start="6177" data-end="6254">En la parte inferior del panel se ve la puntuación actual con iconos de olas.</p>
</li>
<li data-start="6255" data-end="6350">
<p data-start="6257" data-end="6350">También un mensaje claro con color y emoji para indicar si el surf es óptimo, regular o malo.</p>
</li>
</ul>

2.02441L4.30371 1.97363C4.34801 1.86052 4.45804 1.78333 4.58301 1.7832Z"></path></svg>Editar</button></span></div></div></div><div class="overflow-y-auto p-4" dir="ltr"><code class="whitespace-pre! language-bash"><span><span>streamlit run app.py
</span></span></code></div></div></pre>
<ul data-start="291" data-end="416">
<li data-start="291" data-end="354">
<p data-start="293" data-end="354">Prueba distintos spots y fechas para ver que no haya errores.</p>
</li>
<li data-start="356" data-end="416">
<p data-start="358" data-end="416">Ajusta detalles de diseño, mensajes o gráficos si quieres.</p>
</li>
</ul>
<hr data-start="418" data-end="421">
<h3 data-start="423" data-end="454">2. <strong data-start="430" data-end="454">Organiza tu proyecto</strong></h3>
<ul data-start="456" data-end="696">
<li data-start="456" data-end="635">
<p data-start="458" data-end="488">Añade un README.md explicando:</p>
<ul data-start="491" data-end="635">
<li data-start="491" data-end="514">
<p data-start="493" data-end="514">Qué hace el proyecto.</p>
</li>
<li data-start="517" data-end="550">
<p data-start="519" data-end="550">Cómo instalar las dependencias.</p>
</li>
<li data-start="553" data-end="574">
<p data-start="555" data-end="574">Cómo lanzar la app.</p>
</li>
<li data-start="577" data-end="635">
<p data-start="579" data-end="635">Tecnologías usadas (Python, Streamlit, APIs Open-Meteo).</p>
</li>
</ul>
</li>
<li data-start="637" data-end="696">
<p data-start="639" data-end="696">Añade un <code data-start="648" data-end="666">requirements.txt</code> con las librerías necesarias:</p>
</li>
</ul>

</span></span></code></div></div></pre>
<hr data-start="741" data-end="744">
<h3 data-start="746" data-end="783">3. <strong data-start="753" data-end="783">Publica tu proyecto online</strong></h3>
<ul data-start="785" data-end="1073">
<li data-start="785" data-end="995">
<p data-start="787" data-end="847">Puedes usar plataformas gratuitas para apps Streamlit, como:</p>
<ul data-start="850" data-end="995">
<li data-start="850" data-end="921">
<p data-start="852" data-end="921"><a data-start="852" data-end="897" class="cursor-pointer" rel="noopener" target="_new">Streamlit Cloud</a> (requiere crear cuenta)</p>
</li>
<li data-start="924" data-end="959">
<p data-start="926" data-end="959"><a data-start="926" data-end="959" class="" rel="noopener" target="_new" href="https://www.heroku.com/">Heroku</a></p>
</li>
<li data-start="962" data-end="995">
<p data-start="964" data-end="995"><a data-start="964" data-end="995" class="" rel="noopener" target="_new" href="https://railway.app/">Railway</a></p>
</li>
</ul>
</li>
<li data-start="997" data-end="1073">
<p data-start="999" data-end="1073">Subes el código a un repositorio GitHub y conectas la app a la plataforma.</p>
</li>
</ul>
<hr data-start="1075" data-end="1078">
<h3 data-start="1080" data-end="1117">4. <strong data-start="1087" data-end="1117">Inclúyelo en tu portafolio</strong></h3>
<ul data-start="1119" data-end="1275">
<li data-start="1119" data-end="1219">
<p data-start="1121" data-end="1219">Añade capturas de pantalla, URL de la app online, descripción y código en tu portafolio web o PDF.</p>
</li>
<li data-start="1221" data-end="1275">
<p data-start="1223" data-end="1275">Explica el objetivo, retos y qué tecnologías usaste.</p>
</li>
</ul>
<hr data-start="1277" data-end="1280">
<h3 data-start="1282" data-end="1320">5. <strong data-start="1289" data-end="1320">Opcional: sigue mejorándolo</strong></h3>
<ul data-start="1322" data-end="1487">
<li data-start="1322" data-end="1395">
<p data-start="1324" data-end="1395">Añade más spots, o más datos (mareas reales, temperatura del mar, etc).</p>
</li>
<li data-start="1397" data-end="1437">
<p data-start="1399" data-end="1437">Añade autenticación o personalización.</p>
</li>
<li data-start="1439" data-end="1487">
<p data-start="1441" data-end="1487">Mejora la UI con más visualizaciones o diseño.</p>
</li>
</ul>
<hr data-start="1489" data-end="1492">

<h1 data-start="145" data-end="172">Surf Dashboard - Canarias</h1>
<p data-start="174" data-end="283">Proyecto para visualizar condiciones de surf en spots de Gran Canaria usando Streamlit y datos de Open-Meteo.</p>
<hr data-start="285" data-end="288">
<h2 data-start="290" data-end="304">Instalación</h2>
<ol data-start="306" data-end="357">
<li data-start="306" data-end="357">
<p data-start="309" data-end="357"><strong data-start="309" data-end="333">Clona el repositorio</strong> (o descarga el código):</p>
</li>
</ol>

<ol start="2" data-start="449" data-end="517">
<li data-start="449" data-end="517">
<p data-start="452" data-end="517"><strong data-start="452" data-end="517">Crea y activa un entorno virtual (opcional pero recomendado):</strong></p>

<p data-start="519" data-end="543">En Windows (PowerShell):</p>
<pre class="overflow-visible!" data-start="545" data-end="610"><div class="contain-inline-size rounded-2xl relative bg-token-sidebar-surface-primary"><div class="flex items-center <p data-start="672" data-end="714">Esto abrirá la aplicación en tu navegador.</p>

language-markdown"><span><span><span class="hljs-section"># Surf Dashboard - Gran Canaria</span></span><span>

Este proyecto muestra las condiciones de surf en 4 puntos clave de la isla de Gran Canaria.

Está desarrollado con Python y Streamlit, y utiliza APIs de Open-Meteo para obtener datos meteorológicos y marinos en tiempo real.

---

</span><span><span class="hljs-section">## Tecnologías utilizadas</span></span><span>

</span><span><span class="hljs-bullet">-</span></span><span> Python
</span><span><span class="hljs-bullet">-</span></span><span> Streamlit
</span><span><span class="hljs-bullet">-</span></span><span> Pandas
</span><span><span class="hljs-bullet">-</span></span><span> Requests
</span><span><span class="hljs-bullet">-</span></span><span> Plotly
</span><span><span class="hljs-bullet">-</span></span><span> Pydeck
</span><span><span class="hljs-bullet">-</span></span><span> APIs Open-Meteo

---

</span><span><span class="hljs-section">## Instalación y ejecución</span></span><span>

</span><span><span class="hljs-section">### 1. Clonar el repositorio</span></span><span>

<span class="hljs-code">```bash
git clone https://github.com/tu_usuario/tu_repositorio.git
cd tu_repositorio
</span></span></span></code></div></div></pre>

language-bash"><span><span>streamlit run app.py
</span></span></code></div></div></pre>
<p data-start="1194" data-end="1251">Esto abrirá la aplicación en el navegador predeterminado.</p>
<hr data-start="1253" data-end="1256">
<h2 data-start="1258" data-end="1285">Descripción del proyecto</h2>
<p data-start="1287" data-end="1557">La aplicación permite visualizar en un mapa interactivo los spots de surf con un indicador de las condiciones actuales (alturas de olas, viento, periodo de swell), y un sistema visual de puntuación con iconos para mostrar si las condiciones son buenas o no para surfear.</p>
<p data-start="1559" data-end="1672">Además incluye gráficos con la evolución horaria de las variables y un indicador visual de las mareas (simulado).</p>
<hr data-start="1674" data-end="1677">
<p data-start="1679" data-end="1769">¿Quieres que te ayude también a generar el archivo <code data-start="1730" data-end="1748">requirements.txt</code> con las versiones?</p>

class="text-base my-auto mx-auto py-5 [--thread-content-margin:--spacing(4)] @[37rem]:[--thread-content-margin:--spacing(6)] @[72rem]:[--thread-content-margin:--spacing(16)] px-(--thread-content-margin)"><div class="[--thread-content-max-width:32rem] @[34rem]:[--thread-content-max-width:40rem] @[64rem]:[--thread-content-max-width:48rem] mx-auto flex max-w-(--thread-content-max-width) flex-1 text-base gap-4 md:gap-5 lg:gap-6 group/turn-messages focus-visible:outline-hidden" tabindex="-1"><div class="group/conversation-turn relative flex w-full min-w-0 flex-col"><div class="relative flex-col gap-1 md:gap-3"><div class="flex max-w-full flex-col grow"><div data-message-author-role="user" data-message-id="876ee152-1010-40e0-9425-3d233a6e39a5" dir="auto" class="min-h-8 text-message relative flex w-full flex-col items-end gap-2 text-start break-words whitespace-normal [.text-message+&amp;]:mt-5"><div class="flex w-full flex-col gap-1 empty:hidden items-end rtl:items-start"><div class="relative max-w-[var(--user-chat-width,70%)] bg-token-message-surface rounded-3xl px-5 py-2.5"><div class="whitespace-pre-wrap"># Surf Dashboard - Gran Canaria - Yone Suarez

Este proyecto muestra las condiciones de surf en 4 puntos clave de la isla de Gran Canaria.

Está desarrollado con Python y Streamlit, y utiliza APIs de Open-Meteo para obtener datos meteorológicos y marinos en tiempo real.

---

## Tecnologías utilizadas

- Python
- Streamlit
- Pandas
- Requests
- Plotly
- Pydeck
- APIs Open-Meteo

---

## Instalación y ejecución

### 1. Clonar el repositorio

<pre class="overflow-x-auto"><code>bash
git clone https://github.com/tu_usuario/tu_repositorio.git
cd tu_repositorio

### 2. Crear y activar un entorno virtual (opcional pero recomendado)
Windows (PowerShell):

powershell
Copiar
Editar
python -m venv venv
.\venv\Scripts\Activate.ps1
macOS/Linux:

bash
Copiar
Editar
python3 -m venv venv
source venv/bin/activate
3. Instalar dependencias
bash
Copiar
Editar
pip install -r requirements.txt
4. Ejecutar la aplicación

streamlit run app.py</code></pre></div></div></div></div></div><div class="flex justify-end"><div class="touch:-me-2 touch:-ms-3.5 -ms-2.5 -me-1 flex flex-wrap items-center gap-y-4 p-1 select-none 2.0332 4.87891C1.88897 4.85446 1.7832 4.72938 1.7832 4.58301C1.78335 4.43673 1.88902 4.3115 2.0332 4.28711C2.72366 4.17203 3.22481 3.88861 3.58203 3.50391C3.94186 3.11638 4.17214 2.60888 4.28906 language-markdown"><span><span><span class="hljs-section"># Surf Dashboard - Gran Canaria - Yone Suarez</span></span><span>

Este proyecto muestra las condiciones de surf en 4 puntos clave de la isla de Gran Canaria.

Está desarrollado con Python y Streamlit, y utiliza APIs de Open-Meteo para obtener datos meteorológicos y marinos en tiempo real.

---

</span><span><span class="hljs-section">## Tecnologías utilizadas</span></span><span>

</span><span><span class="hljs-bullet">-</span></span><span> Python
</span><span><span class="hljs-bullet">-</span></span><span> Streamlit
</span><span><span class="hljs-bullet">-</span></span><span> Pandas
</span><span><span class="hljs-bullet">-</span></span><span> Requests
</span><span><span class="hljs-bullet">-</span></span><span> Plotly
</span><span><span class="hljs-bullet">-</span></span><span> Pydeck
</span><span><span class="hljs-bullet">-</span></span><span> APIs Open-Meteo

---

</span><span><span class="hljs-section">## Instalación y ejecución</span></span><span>

</span><span><span class="hljs-section">### 1. Clonar el repositorio</span></span><span>

<span class="hljs-code">```bash
git clone https://github.com/tu_usuario/tu_repositorio.git
cd tu_repositorio
</span></span></span></code></div></div></pre>

language-markdown"><span><span><span class="hljs-section"># Surf Dashboard - Gran Canaria - Yone Suarez</span></span><span>

Este proyecto muestra las condiciones de surf en 4 puntos clave de la isla de Gran Canaria.

Está desarrollado con Python y Streamlit, y utiliza APIs de Open-Meteo para obtener datos meteorológicos y marinos en tiempo real.

---

</span><span><span class="hljs-section">## Tecnologías utilizadas</span></span><span>

</span><span><span class="hljs-bullet">-</span></span><span> Python
</span><span><span class="hljs-bullet">-</span></span><span> Streamlit
</span><span><span class="hljs-bullet">-</span></span><span> Pandas
</span><span><span class="hljs-bullet">-</span></span><span> Requests
</span><span><span class="hljs-bullet">-</span></span><span> Plotly
</span><span><span class="hljs-bullet">-</span></span><span> Pydeck
</span><span><span class="hljs-bullet">-</span></span><span> APIs Open-Meteo

---

</span><span><span class="hljs-section">## Instalación y ejecución</span></span><span>

</span><span><span class="hljs-section">### 1. Clonar el repositorio</span></span><span>

<span class="hljs-code">```bash
git clone https://github.com/tu_usuario/tu_repositorio.git
cd tu_repositorio
</span></span></span></code></div></div></pre>
<h3 data-start="662" data-end="731">2. Crear y activar un entorno virtual (opcional pero recomendado)</h3>
<p data-start="733" data-end="758"><strong data-start="733" data-end="758">Windows (PowerShell):</strong></p>

data-scroll-anchor="false" style=""><h6 class="sr-only">ChatGPT Plus</h6><div class="text-base my-auto mx-auto py-5 [--thread-content-margin:--spacing(4)] @[37rem]:[--thread-content-margin:--spacing(6)] @[72rem]:[--thread-content-margin:--spacing(16)] px-(--thread-content-margin)"><div class="[--thread-content-max-width:32rem] @[34rem]:[--thread-content-max-width:40rem] @[64rem]:[--thread-content-max-width:48rem] mx-auto flex max-w-(--thread-content-max-width) flex-1 text-base gap-4 md:gap-5 lg:gap-6 group/turn-messages focus-visible:outline-hidden" tabindex="-1"><div class="group/conversation-turn relative flex w-full min-w-0 flex-col agent-turn"><div class="relative flex-col gap-1 md:gap-3"><div class="flex max-w-full flex-col grow"><div data-message-author-role="assistant" data-message-id="ca6fd8cb-b8ad-4d61-98bb-2aebed27ad86" dir="auto" class="min-h-8 text-message relative flex w-full flex-col items-end gap-2 text-start break-words whitespace-normal [.text-message+&amp;]:mt-5" data-message-model-slug="gpt-4-1-mini"><div class="flex w-full flex-col gap-1 empty:hidden first:pt-[3px]"><div class="markdown prose dark:prose-invert w-full break-words light"><p data-start="0" data-end="229">Si quieres que otras personas puedan ejecutar tu proyecto fácilmente en sus máquinas (o incluso tú mismo en otro equipo o en el futuro), <strong data-start="137" data-end="215">es muy recomendable incluir el paso 2 (crear y activar un entorno virtual)</strong> en el README.</p>
<p data-start="231" data-end="240">¿Por qué?</p>
<ul data-start="242" data-end="455">
<li data-start="242" data-end="329">
<p data-start="244" data-end="329">Para evitar conflictos entre librerías y versiones que tengas instaladas globalmente.</p>
</li>
<li data-start="330" data-end="400">
<p data-start="332" data-end="400">Para que las dependencias del proyecto estén aisladas y controladas.</p>
</li>
<li data-start="401" data-end="455">
<p data-start="403" data-end="455">Para que la instalación sea más limpia y predecible.</p>
</li>
</ul>
<hr data-start="457" data-end="460">
<p data-start="462" data-end="479"><strong data-start="462" data-end="477">En resumen:</strong></p>
<ul data-start="481" data-end="633">
<li data-start="481" data-end="541">
<p data-start="483" data-end="541">Si el README es para ti solo, podrías saltarte ese paso.</p>
</li>
<li data-start="542" data-end="633">
<p data-start="544" data-end="633">Si quieres que sea un README profesional y útil para cualquiera, mejor incluye el paso 2.</p>
</li>
</ul>
<hr data-start="635" data-end="638">
<p data-start="640" data-end="767" data-is-last-node="" data-is-only-node="">Si quieres, te preparo el README sin ese paso para copiar y pegar, o con alguna nota indicando que es opcional. ¿Qué prefieres?</p></div></div></div></div><div class="flex min-h-[46px] justify-start"><div class="touch:-me-2 touch:-ms-3.5 -ms-2.5 -me-1 flex flex-wrap items-center gap-y-4 p-1 select-none class="ͼl">"lat"</span>].<span class="ͼn">mean</span>(), <span class="ͼo">df_spots</span>[<span class="ͼl">"lon"</span>].<span class="ͼn">mean</span>())</div><div class="cm-line"><br></div><div class="cm-line"><span class="ͼo">st</span>.<span class="ͼn">set_page_config</span>(<span class="ͼo">page_title</span>=<span class="ͼl">"Surf Dashboard - Canarias"</span>, <span class="cm-line"><span class="ͼh"># Mostrar mapa con marcadores</span></div><div class="cm-line"><span class="ͼo">st</span>.<span class="ͼn">pydeck_chart</span>(<span class="ͼo">pdk</span>.<span class="cm-line">    <span class="ͼo">initial_view_state</span>=<span class="ͼo">pdk</span>.<span class="ͼn">ViewState</span>(</div><div class="cm-line">        <span class="ͼo">latitude</span>=<span  ),</div><div class="cm-line">    <span class="ͼo">layers</span>=[</div><div class="cm-line">        <span class="ͼo">pdk</span>.<span class="ͼn">Layer</span>(</div><div class="cm-line"> ],</div><div class="cm-line">    <span class="ͼo">tooltip</span>={<span class="ͼl">"text"</span>: <span class="ͼl">"{Spot}"</span>}</div><div class="cm-line">))</div><div class="cm-line"><br></div><div class="cm-line"><span class="ͼh"># Función para obtener datos marinos</span></div><div class="cm-line"><span class="ͼk">def</span> <span class="ͼo">get_wave_data</span>(<span class="ͼo">lat</span>, <span class="ͼo">lon</span>, <span class="ͼo">start_date</span>, <span class="ͼo">end_date</span>):</div><div class="cm-line">    <span class="ͼo">url</span> = <span class="ͼl">"https://marine-api.open-meteo.com/v1/marine"</span></div><div class="cm-line">    <span class="ͼo">params</span> = {</div><div class="cm-line">        <span class="ͼl">"latitude"</span>: <span class="ͼo">lat</span>,</div><div class="cm-line">        <span class="ͼl">"longitude"</span>: <span class="ͼo">lon</span>,</div><div class="cm-line">        <span class="ͼl">"hourly"</span>: <span class="ͼl">"wave_height,wind_wave_height,swell_wave_height,wind_wave_direction,swell_wave_period"</span>,</div><div class="cm-line">        <span class="ͼl">"start_date"</span>: <span class="ͼo">start_date</span>,</div><div class="cm-line">        <span class="ͼl">"end_date"</span>: <span class="ͼo">end_date</span>,</div><div class="cm-line">        <span class="ͼl">"timezone"</span>: <span class="ͼl">"auto"</span></div><div class="cm-line">    }</div><div class="cm-line">    <span class="ͼo">response</span> = <span class="ͼo">requests</span>.<span class="ͼn">get</span>(<span class="ͼo">url</span>, <span class="ͼo">params</span>=<span class="ͼo">params</span>)</div><div class="cm-line">    <span class="ͼo">data</span> = <span class="ͼo">response</span>.<span class="ͼn">json</span>()</div><div class="cm-line">    <span class="ͼo">st</span>.<span class="ͼn">write</span>(<span class="ͼl">"Datos crudos API marina:"</span>, <span class="ͼo">data</span>)</div><div class="cm-line">    <span class="ͼk">if</span> <span class="ͼl">"hourly"</span> <span class="ͼk">not</span> <span class="ͼk">in</span> <span class="ͼo">data</span>:</div><div class="cm-line">        <span class="ͼo">st</span>.<span class="ͼn">error</span>(<span class="ͼl">"No se encontraron datos horarios marinos en la respuesta de la API."</span>)</div><div class="cm-line">        <span class="ͼk">return</span> <span class="ͼo">pd</span>.<span class="ͼn">DataFrame</span>()</div><div class="cm-line">    <span class="ͼo">df</span> = <span class="ͼo">pd</span>.<span class="ͼn">DataFrame</span>(<span class="ͼo">data</span>[<span class="ͼl">"hourly"</span>])</div><div class="cm-line">    <span class="ͼk">if</span> <span class="ͼk">not</span> <span class="ͼo">df</span>.<span class="ͼn">empty</span>:</div><div class="cm-line">        <span class="ͼo">df</span>[<span class="ͼl">"time"</span>] = <span class="ͼo">pd</span>.<span class="ͼn">to_datetime</span>(<span class="ͼo">df</span>[<span class="ͼl">"time"</span>])</div><div class="cm-line">    <span class="ͼk">return</span> <span class="ͼo">df</span></div><div class="cm-line"><br></div><div class="cm-line"><span class="ͼh"># Función para obtener datos meteorológicos (viento)</span></div><div class="cm-line"><span class="ͼk">def</span> <span class="ͼo">get_weather_data</span>(<span class="ͼo">lat</span>, <span class="ͼo">lon</span>, <span class="ͼo">start_date</span>, <span class="ͼo">end_date</span>):</div><div class="cm-line">    <span class="ͼo">url</span> = <span class="ͼl">"https://api.open-meteo.com/v1/forecast"</span></div><div class="cm-line">    <span class="ͼo">params</span> = {</div><div class="cm-line">        <span class="ͼl">"latitude"</span>: <span class="ͼo">lat</span>,</div><div class="cm-line">        <span class="ͼl">"longitude"</span>: <span class="ͼo">lon</span>,</div><div class="cm-line">        <span class="ͼl">"hourly"</span>: <span class="ͼl">"windspeed_10m"</span>,</div><div class="cm-line">        <span class="ͼl">"start"</span>: <span class="ͼo">start_date</span>,</div><div class="cm-line">        <span class="ͼl">"end"</span>: <span class="ͼo">end_date</span>,</div><div class="cm-line">        <span class="ͼl">"timezone"</span>: <span class="ͼl">"auto"</span></div><div class="cm-line">    }</div><div class="cm-line">    <span class="ͼo">response</span> = <span class="ͼo">requests</span>.<span class="ͼn">get</span>(<span class="ͼo">url</span>, <span class="ͼo">params</span>=<span class="ͼo">params</span>)</div><div class="cm-line">    <span class="ͼo">data</span> = <span class="ͼo">response</span>.<span class="ͼn">json</span>()</div><div class="cm-line">    <span class="ͼo">st</span>.<span class="ͼn">write</span>(<span class="ͼl">"Datos crudos API meteorológica:"</span>, <span class="ͼo">data</span>)</div><div class="cm-line">    <span class="ͼk">if</span> <span class="ͼl">"hourly"</span> <span class="ͼk">not</span> <span class="ͼk">in</span> <span class="ͼo">data</span>:</div><div class="cm-line">        <span class="ͼo">st</span>.<span class="ͼn">error</span>(<span class="ͼl">"No se encontraron datos horarios meteorológicos en la respuesta de la API."</span>)</div><div class="cm-line">        <span class="ͼk">return</span> <span class="ͼo">pd</span>.<span class="ͼn">DataFrame</span>()</div><div class="cm-line">    <span class="ͼo">df</span> = <span class="ͼo">pd</span>.<span class="ͼn">DataFrame</span>(<span class="ͼo">data</span>[<span class="ͼl">"hourly"</span>])</div><div class="cm-line">    <span class="ͼk">if</span> <span class="ͼk">not</span> <span class="ͼo">df</span>.<span class="ͼn">empty</span>:</div><div class="cm-line">        <span class="ͼo">df</span>[<span class="ͼk">return</span> <span class="ͼo">df</span></div><div class="cm-line"><br></div><div class="cm-line"><span class="ͼh"># Función para obtener datos de mareas desde Puertos del Estado (simulado para Las Palmas)</span></div><div class="cm-line"><span class="ͼk">def</span> <span class="ͼo">get_tides_puertos</span>(<span class="ͼo">start_date</span>, <span class="ͼo">end_date</span>):</div><div class="cm-line">    <span class="ͼo">example_data</span> = {</div><div class="cm-line">        <span class="ͼl">"datetime"</span>: <span class="ͼo">pd</span>.<span class="ͼn">date_range</span>(<span class="cm-line">        <span class="ͼl">"tide"</span>: [<span class="ͼm">0.5</span> + <span class="ͼm">0.3</span> * ((<span class="ͼo">i</span> % <span class="ͼm">12</span>) / <span class="ͼm">6</span> - <span class="ͼm">1</span>)**<span class="ͼm">2</span> <span class="ͼk">for</span> <span class="ͼo">i</span> <span class="ͼk">in</span> <span class="ͼo">range</span>(<span class="ͼm">48</span>)]</div><div class="cm-line">    }</div><div class="cm-line">    <span class="ͼk">return</span> <span class="ͼo">pd</span>.<span class="ͼn">DataFrame</span>(<span class="ͼo">example_data</span>)</div><div class="cm-line"><br></div><div class="cm-line"><span class="ͼh"># Función para evaluar condiciones de surf y asignar una puntuación de 1 a 5</span></div><div class="cm-line"><span class="ͼk">def</span> <span class="ͼo">evaluar_condiciones</span>(<span class="ͼo">row</span>):</div><div class="cm-line">    <span class="ͼo">score</span> = <span class="ͼm">0</span></div><div class="cm-line">    <span class="ͼk">if</span> <span class="ͼm">0.8</span> &lt;= <span class="ͼo">row</span>[<span class="ͼl">'wave_height'</span>] &lt;= <span class="ͼm">2.0</span>:</div><div class="cm-line">        <span class="ͼo">score</span> += <span class="ͼm">2</span></div><div class="cm-line">    <span class="ͼk">elif</span> <span class="ͼm">0.5</span> &lt;= <span class="ͼo">row</span>[<span class="ͼl">'wave_height'</span>] &lt; <span class="ͼm">0.8</span>:</div><div class="cm-line">        <span class="ͼo">score</span> += <span class="ͼm">1</span></div><div class="cm-line">    <span class="ͼk">if</span> <span class="ͼo">row</span>[<span class="ͼl">'swell_wave_period'</span>] &gt;= <span class="ͼm">10</span>:</div><div class="cm-line">        <span class="ͼo">score</span> += <span class="ͼm">2</span></div><div class="cm-line">    <span class="ͼk">elif</span> <span class="ͼo">row</span>[<span class="ͼl">'swell_wave_period'</span>] &gt;= <span class="ͼm">7</span>:</div><div class="cm-line">        <span class="ͼo">score</span> += <span class="ͼm">1</span></div><div class="cm-line">    <span class="ͼk">if</span> <span class="ͼo">row</span>[<span class="ͼl">'windspeed_10m'</span>] &lt; <span class="ͼm">15</span>:</div><div class="cm-line">        <span class="ͼo">score</span> += <span
